title: Senior Software Developer
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------



Join our Business Support Solutions team as a Senior Software Developer and play a central role in large-scale software development with a focus on charging and 5G!  

  

**About this opportunity:**  

With us, you get to contribute to a world where limitless connectivity improves lives, redefines businesses, and helps pioneer a sustainable future. You will build systems using industry-standard technologies for virtualization and cloud environments, with a strong emphasis on delivering excellent user experience.

  

Enjoy a collaborative, energetic workplace with excellent career progression and professional development opportunities. Apply now to become part of our talented teams and experience the added benefit of living in the picturesque World Heritage town of Karlskrona!

 **The Team**  

We are a mid-size, cross-functional team of experienced software engineers passionate about building high-quality products. We develop both back-end and front-end solutions and are working in a close collaboration with our colleagues in India.  

We follow a customer-driven approach with high performance and reliability as strong priorities, embracing modern development practices using AI technology in all parts of the development process to increase productivity and improve outcomes. Our working methodology is based on automation and continuous integration/continuous deployment as our corner stones.  

  

**The Role**  

As a Senior Software Developer, you will take on a wide range of different development activities including requirement analysis, software design, integration, verification, tool design and product troubleshooting. You will tackle technical challenges and complex problems that will require strong analytical thinking and a proactive approach. This opportunity offers you the possibility for professional growth, progressing into more technical leadership roles.

 **To be successful in the role we believe you need:**  

  

* A Master’s or Bachelor’s Degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science or similar.
* Excellent skills in software programming languages: Java, JavaScript/TypeScript and Python.
* Good knowledge of industry standard frameworks like Java EE, OSGi, Angular, Springboot etc.
* Good knowledge in development environments and tools like Jira, Git, Gerrit, Maven, Jenkins etc.
* Knowledgeable in containerization & cloud technics.
* A creative soul and love to find new paths, innovations and solutions.
* Leaderships skills in the sense of being brave enough to take full responsibility for your area of tasks and personal development, and in the long run also for the team or complete product.
* A positive, analytic and inspiring approach to your everyday work.
* Strong teamwork skills.
* Proficiency in English, since we are a big player in the global environment.

  

**Why us?**  

Working at Ericsson Karlskrona means working in an inspiring, fun, and creative environment. Our guiding lights are respect, perseverance, professionalism and integrity. We bring passion to everything we do and believe in the power of collaboration and continuous learning. Once settled into the development role we can offer several technical career paths.

title: Senior .NET-utvecklare
description:
Senior .NET-utvecklare – bli en viktig del av Deverythings konsultteam


Vill du utvecklas inom modern .NET-utveckling, jobba i spännande uppdrag och samtidigt vara anställd i ett familjärt konsultbolag där du verkligen får påverka?  

Då kan rollen som Senior .NET-utvecklare hos Deverything vara helt rätt för dig.

**Varför Deverything?**
-----------------------

* Fast anställning och trygga villkor
* Variation i uppdrag – men stabilitet i ett och samma bolag
* Stort fokus på kompetensutveckling och kontinuerligt lärande
* Uppdrag där modern teknik och skalbarhet står i centrum
* Direkta möjligheter att påverka både uppdrag, tech-val och företagets framtid
* Ett litet och familjärt bolag där alla syns, hörs och gör skillnad
* Kunder inom automotive, telecom och aerospace

**Rollen**
----------


Som Senior .NET-utvecklare hos Deverything arbetar du i uppdrag där kvalitet, arkitektur och moderna utvecklingsmetoder är avgörande. Du ingår i agila team och är med och bygger robusta system, API:er och molnbaserade lösningar.


Du kommer att:

* utveckla tjänster i C#/.NET och bygga skalbara API:er
* brainstorma funktioner tillsammans med PO och arkitekter
* arbeta nära andra utvecklare i agila team
* skriva testbar, hållbar kod enligt SOLID
* leverera kontinuerligt till molnplattformar
* bidra till best practices, coacha och dela kunskap

**Så här kan en typisk vecka hos oss se ut**
--------------------------------------------

* Konceptualisera nya features tillsammans med teamet
* Implementera ny funktionalitet i .NET 6+ / .NET Core
* Delta i arkitekturdiskussioner och designsessioner
* Reviewa kod och höja kvalitet i teamet
* Leverera till Azure/AWS och följa upp i drift
* Lära dig ny teknik och bidra med idéer och förbättringar

**Kvalifikationer**
-------------------

### **Du har flera års erfarenhet av:**

* C# (.NET 6+, .NET Core)
* REST API:er – både konsumera och exponera
* ORM (Entity Framework, Dapper)
* Enhetstester (xUnit, NUnit)
* Mock-ramverk (Moq, NSubstitute)
* Containerteknik (Docker eller liknande)
* Relationsdatabaser (MS SQL, PostgreSQL, MySQL, Oracle)
* CI/CD (Azure DevOps, Jenkins, GitHub Actions m.fl.)
* Git
* OpenAPI
* Molndeployments (Azure, AWS eller Google Cloud)
* Meddelandeköer: Azure Service Bus, Event Hub, AWS SQS eller Kafka
* Frontendramverk (React, Angular eller Ember)

### **Meriterande om du även har erfarenhet av:**

* Liquibase
* NoSQL (MongoDB, DynamoDB m.fl.)
* GraphQL
* Testautomation (load, security, integration)
* Automationsramverk (Ansible, Puppet, Chef, CloudFormation)
* SPA-utveckling

**Vem är du?**
--------------

* Analytisk, självgående och nyfiken
* Drivs av att lösa problem och förbättra helheter
* Följer SOLID-principerna och bygger skalbara lösningar
* Trivs i agila team och delar gärna med dig av kunskap
* Passionerad kring utveckling och modern teknik
* Bekväm med förändring och gillar att driva utveckling framåt

**Är du vår nästa kollega?**
----------------------------


Skicka din ansökan redan idag!  

Du kan ansöka med CV eller LinkedIn-profil.  

Vi intervjuar löpande och ser fram emot att höra från dig.

title: Developer
description:
Want to build reliable solutions that make an impact for millions of readers? At Aller Media Tech, we build platforms that support some of the strongest media brands in the Nordics.
   

  

 We’re looking for a developer to join our Product Platform area and help build the platform behind Aller Media’s news sites. Ship fast, server-rendered experiences with great performance, clean HTML/CSS, and JavaScript.
   

  

 This role suits someone who likes simple, durable technology choices, enjoys solving hard problems close to the fundamentals, and wants their work to be felt by millions of readers.
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

 You’ll join a Nordic media company with strong brands and real societal impact. You’ll work in product-oriented teams with clear ownership, pragmatic decision-making, and room to influence how we build. We value learning, psychological safety, and collaboration across disciplines.
   

  

 Aller Media offers exciting technical challenges, knowledge sharing, and a strong focus on personal and professional development with great colleagues. We offer competitive benefits, including pension, health insurance, and flexibility.
   

  

 What you’ll work on
   

  

 Your work will span the full stack, including:
   

  

* Building and evolving server-rendered experiences in Node.js/Express
* Working with HTTP, caching strategies, and CDN/edge capabilities (e.g., edge workers)
* Writing semantic HTML and modern, framework-independent CSS
* Implementing interactive features with functional, framework-free JavaScript
* Optimizing client-side performance (Core Web Vitals, loading strategies, rendering cost)
* Ensuring accessibility and inclusive design in everyday development
* Experience from display advertising, video, or media environments is a plus, but not required.


 Where will you be located?
   

  

 Your office location is either Stockholm, Oslo, or Copenhagen.
   

  

 Regardless of office affiliation, occasional travel will be required to collaborate with people across Denmark, Sweden, Finland, and Norway. The team has an office-first policy with flexibility.
   

  

 Ready to apply?
   

  

 Please note that this position is within Aller Media Nordic, by clicking apply for this position you will be redirected to the Aller Media Nordic career page. The application deadline is
 **February 10th** 
 . Please submit your CV and respond to the questions using the link below.
   

  

 Only applications submitted via the link will be considered. We conduct interviews on an ongoing basis and may close the posting once the right candidate is found. If you have questions about the position, please reach out to Head of Product Platform Pelin Gottfredsen on pelin.gottfredsen@aller.com.
   

  

 We are looking forward to hearing from you!

title: Software Engineer
description:
Are you a Software Engineer looking for a high-impact role in fintech? At Brite, we’re building solutions to simplify payments for thousands of users across Europe. We're looking for a Software Engineer to join one of our teams in the Merchant domain to focus on developing user-facing payment applications.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 As a Software Engineer at Brite, you’ll work within a collaborative, cross-functional team to develop user-focused payment applications and scalable systems. Your role will lean heavily towards backend development, crafting the robust and scalable APIs that power our user experiences. On the frontend side you’ll bring ideas to life, ensuring seamless usability and innovation!
   

  

**Are you a brite mind?**
* 3+ years of hands-on experience in software development, with deep expertise in Python.
* A degree in Computer Science or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience
* Mindset: Proactive, adaptable, collaborative, and enjoys problem-solving in a fast-paced environment.


**Meriting experience:**
* Proficiency in React framework, as well as HTML, SCSS, and JavaScript/TypeScript.
* Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure).
* Familiarity with design tools like Figma and working closely with designers.
* Knowledge of Open Banking and PSD2.


**Why join Brite?**
* Supportive Team: Collaborate with skilled colleagues who are passionate about success and teamwork.
* Make an Impact: Contribute in a dynamic, fast-paced environment where ideas matter, and growth is fueled by shared learning.
* Flexibility: Fully Remote or Hybrid work from the Stockholm office, or why not join our Malaga office?
* Career Growth: We support professional development and career advancement.


 Do you want to learn more about our recruitment process? Here you can read about the hiring flow and find answers to the most frequently asked questions.
   

  

**About Brite**
 Founded in 2019, Brite Payments is a leading open banking-powered account-to-account (A2A) payment provider of instant payments, payouts, and other financial services in Europe. Brite is committed to creating fast, secure, and transparent payment solutions that reduce risk for businesses and provide consumers with the best possible payment experience.
   

  

 At the heart of Brite is our proprietary instant payments network, Brite IPN, which enables real-time, 24/7 transaction processing with no delays, sign-ups, or card details required. Today, Brite connects with over 3,800 banks in 27 European markets and is committed to delivering cutting-edge, next-generation payment solutions that meet the market’s evolving needs.
   

  

 Headquartered in Stockholm, Brite has offices in London and Malaga and now numbers over 170+ colleagues.
   

  

 Want to join us on our journey? The future is Brite!

title: Software Engineer
description:
**⚡️ What We Do**
 Flower is Flexible Power. We are a next-gen energy company leveraging AI and machine learning to make renewable energy stable and always available – even when the sun isn’t shining and the wind isn’t blowing.
   

  

 Through smart optimization and trading of energy assets like wind and solar farms, battery systems, and EV chargers, we make renewable energy reliable and predictable, leading the charge towards the energy system of tomorrow.
   

  

**🌟Who We Are**
 Tech company at heart. Purpose-driven at core. Flower consists of a diverse group of innovative individuals with a strong desire to improve the state of the world.
   

  

 At Flower, we believe trust, collaboration and diversity are essential to not only create an inclusive work environment, but also drive career growth. By embracing varying perspectives, we allow creativity and progress to flourish.
   

  

 To accelerate towards our goal of becoming the pioneering force powering the energy system of tomorrow, we are now looking for a passionate and skilled Software Engineer
 **.**
**👩‍💻 About The Role**
 As a Software Engineer in the Distributed Assets team, you will build and scale the technical foundation that enables Flower to connect, operate, and optimize thousands of distributed energy assets. You will work across integrations, telemetry pipelines, backend APIs, and platform reliability while contributing to a modern, AI-assisted engineering culture. This role is both hands-on and high-impact, central to Flower’s ability to grow its flexibility portfolio across partners, assets, and markets.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Build integrations with partners, OEMs, and energy assets
* Develop APIs, automation workflows, event-driven systems, and monitoring tools
* Design scalable data pipelines for telemetry and performance analytics
* Strengthen system reliability, observability, and readiness for new markets
* Support partner onboarding, debugging, and prequalification
* Contribute to architectural discussions and reduce technical debt
* Operate with full ownership from design → deployment → production monitoring


**Who You Are**
* An experienced software engineer with strong backend or platform skills
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Engineering Physics, or a closely related technical field.
* Self-driven, structured, and motivated by delivering meaningful impact in a fast-moving environment
* Comfortable with cloud technologies (preferably AWS) and distributed systems
* Skilled in building APIs, integrations, or data pipelines
* A hands-on problem solver who enjoys working close to real-world operations
* Good communicator with the ability to collaborate across technical and non-technical teams
* Curious about energy, IoT, and optimization, or excited to learn
* Self-driven, structured, and motivated by delivering meaningful impact in a fast-moving environment
* Fluency in English, both written and spoken


**📍 Location**
 Our beautiful office is located in the heart of Södermalm just a short walk from Slussen subway station. We encourage in-office collaboration but support a hybrid work model.
   

  

**✉️ Apply**
 Our corporate language is English, as we have over 30 nationalities in the office. We therefore appreciate it if you could submit your CV in English.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

*We kindly but firmly decline any engagement in recruitment assistance for our hiring processes. This includes partnership offers or the sale of recruitment tools.*

title: Fullstack Developer - Customer & Payments Domain
description:
Do you want to help shape the future of how Aller Media identifies, engages, and supports millions of customers across the Nordics?
   

  

 Are you excited by modern fullstack development, data-driven customer journeys, and building reliable platforms that drive real business outcomes?
   

  

 If so, you might be the one we’re looking for.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Fullstack Developer, you will join one of our three product teams within the Customer & Payments domain—the central tech area responsible for identity and login systems, subscription lifecycle, paywalls, payments, customer data, and customer-activation platforms.
   

  

 Your team will develop and evolve the solutions that power seamless, secure, and intuitive customer journeys across all Aller markets. Today this includes our storefronts, self-service portals, subscription flows, and integrations across the Nordic ecosystem. As we move toward a unified Nordic customer platform, you will play a key role in designing and building the next generation of campaign sites, self-service experiences, and supporting APIs.
   

  

 You’ll work closely with Product Managers, Designers, Engineers, and stakeholders across Tech, Commercial, and Editorial. You’ll be part of defining architecture, shaping our frontend and backend stack, and influencing technical direction from the very beginning of major new initiatives.
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

* A strategic, high-impact domain: Your work directly supports Aller’s most business-critical revenue streams and customer relationships.
* Real ownership from day one: Help design and build the new Nordic customer platform and modernize our frontend and backend tech stack.
* Cross-functional, empowered teams: Collaborate with colleagues across Customer & Payments, Commercial, and Editorial to deliver meaningful customer outcomes.
* A modern engineering culture: Continuous learning, open collaboration, and room to explore new technologies and ways of working.


 We offer competitive benefits, including pension, health insurance and flexibility. At Aller Media, we believe creativity, engagement, and strong business results are built best when people work together. That's why we have an office-first approach, while still valuing work-life balance and offering flexibility when it matters.
   

  

 What we’re looking for
   

  

 We are looking for Fullstack Developers with either a strong frontend experience and solid backend understanding or vice versa. You’ll thrive here if you enjoy working across the stack and are curious about how technology shapes customer experiences.
   

  

**We think you’re comfortable with:**
* JavaScript/TypeScript
* React or similar libraries
* Node.js services on the backend
* Designing, consuming, and improving APIs


****It’s a bonus if you have experience with:****
* C# or .NET services
* Subscription, identity, payments, or customer-data platforms
* Building scalable, compliant, customer-facing systems


 Most of all, we value a curious mindset, a willingness to learn, and a collaborative approach. You’re motivated by solving real user and business problems—and by building solutions that last.
   

  

 If you’re excited about shaping transformative customer journeys across the Nordics, we’d love to hear from you.
   

  

**Ready to apply?**
 Please note that this position is within Aller Media Nordic, by clicking apply for this position you will be redirected to the Aller Media Nordic career page. Please apply with your CV and let us know a bit more about why you’re interested in the position as Fullstack Developer. Only applications submitted via the link will be taken into consideration. The application deadline is
 **February 7th** 
 .
   

  

 We will be conducting interviews on an ongoing basis and the job posting may be closed as soon as the right candidate has been found.
   

  

 If you have any questions about the position, please reach out to Engineering Manager, Anna Engberg by email anna.engberg@aller.com.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Backend Developer
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Du kan designa och bygga distribuerade backendtjänster och databaser i stor skala och har god förståelse för datastrukturer och algoritmer.
* Du ligger i framkant när det gäller att använda AI-verktyg för effektiv kodning.
* Du har erfarenhet av att använda Java för att bygga högpresterande backendtjänster. Erfarenhet av Scala är starkt meriterande.
* Du har erfarenhet av modern infrastruktur och molnverktyg, särskilt inom GCP, och är bekväm med att hantera hela livscykeln för en tjänst.
* Du har stor förståelse för distribuerade system och hur diagnostisering av prestandaproblem genomförs i komplexa, sammankopplade backendarkitekturer.


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 19-01-206
   

  

**Om Oss**
 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.
   

  

 Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Frontend Engineer
description:
At Intric, we're on a mission to let everyone benefit from generative AI by making the creation and deployment of AI-based tools easy, open, and secure. Our collaborative web application is already a trusted resource within the Swedish public sector and we’ll now be entering a pivotal growth phase. Join us now and be a core part of our ambitious journey.
   

  

**The Role**
 As a Frontend Engineer, you’ll lead the development of a fast, accessible and scalable web experience. Your work will range from building new features to refining our architecture, always with the end-user in focus. You'll collaborate closely with developers, product designers and business teams to continuously improve the platform across both desktop and mobile.
   

  

 Our tech stack consists of Node, TypeScript, HTML/CSS, Svelte/SvelteKit, Tailwind CSS. Infrastructure: Docker, Git, Jira
   

  

**The** 
**Team**
 You’ll be joining a cross-functional, fast-moving product team with a collaborative mindset. We keep processes lightweight and adapt as we go. You’ll have significant freedom to influence both technology and direction — and we value sharing, learning and pragmatic decisions above hierarchy or rigid frameworks.
   

  

**Qualifications**
 You have 3–5+ years of frontend engineering experience with a solid understanding of core web technologies (HTML/DOM, HTTP, JavaScript/TypeScript). Your experienced in building and scaling modern web applications and proficient in state management and caching (preferably in Svelte or similar frameworks).
   

  

 You can write efficient, maintainable, and accessible code with a collaborative mindset and strong communication skills.
   

  

 You might have a degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
   

  

 While not a must, experience with Svelte/SvelteKit and Tailwind CSS and familiarity with developer tooling and internal workflows is a plus.
   

  

**Perks**
* Flexible, trust-based work environment
* High degree of ownership and influence
* Work on meaningful technology with real societal impact
* A collaborative and curious team that values continuous learning

title: Back End Developer
description:
We are looking for a Backend Engineer to join a team responsible for central systems behind one of the client's most used functions. In this role, you will work on further developing and improving backend solutions that are used by millions of users every day. The focus is on building robust, high-performance and scalable Java services in a cloud environment, as well as working with databases and data pipelines at scale.
 



  





 You will contribute to improving performance and reliability by analyzing bottlenecks and optimizing API usage, while enabling new features and improved user experience. You will work in a cross-functional and independent team where you have clear operational responsibility for the services you develop and manage.
 



  





**Qualifications:** 



* You can design and build distributed backend services and databases at scale and have a good understanding of data structures and algorithms.
* You are at the forefront of using AI tools for efficient coding.
* You have experience using Java to build high-performance backend services. Experience with Scala is a strong asset.
* You have experience with modern infrastructure and cloud tools, especially within GCP, and are comfortable managing the entire lifecycle of a service.
* You have a strong understanding of distributed systems and how diagnosing performance issues is carried out in complex, interconnected backend architectures.



  





 Apply now!

title: AI & Full Stack Developer Intern
description:
**Position:** 
 AI & Full Stack Developer Intern
 



**Location:** 
 Remote
 



**Type:** 
 Unpaid Internship
 



**Start Date:** 
 Immediate
 



**Duration** 
 : 3-6 months (Flexible, Part-Time or Full-Time)
 



  





**Overview:** 




 Are you a tech enthusiast with a passion for both front-end magic and back-end wizardry? We're on the lookout for innovative Full Stack Developers to join our dynamic team and help us build cutting-edge solutions. If you’re ready to shape the future of digital experiences, this is the opportunity for you!
 



 We are currently in the very early stages of developing our beta version and are looking for passionate, driven individuals to join our team and help bring our vision to life.
 



  





**Your Role:** 




 As a Full stack Developer Intern at Gaddr, you will have the unique opportunity to contribute to the development of our platform from the ground up. This role is perfect for someone eager to gain hands-on experience in a fast-paced startup environment and to work on a variety of challenging and innovative projects.
 



  





**What You’ll Do:** 




  





 ·        
 **Backend Development:** 
 Work on building and optimizing the platform’s backend infrastructure, ensuring it is scalable and robust.
 



 ·        
 **Frontend Development:** 
 Design and implement user-friendly interfaces using cutting-edge technologies to create a seamless user experience across web and mobile platforms.
 



 ·        
 **Collaboration:** 
 Work closely with our design, product, and marketing teams to align the technical aspects of our platform with our overall vision.
 



 ·        
 **AI Integration:** 
 Collaborate on integrating AI features into our platform to enhance user interaction and automate processes.
 



 ·        
 **Cloud Hosting & Microservices:**

**What We’re Looking For:**

 ·        Understanding of cloud computing and microservices architecture.

**Why Join Gaddr ?**

 Be part of a startup that’s pushing the boundaries of technology and digital experiences.
 



**Real Impact:** 
 Your contributions will directly influence the development and success of our platform.
 



**Learning Opportunity** 
 : Gain invaluable hands-on experience in full stack development, AI integration, and more.

title: Software Developer (Consultant)
description:
**Come work with us** 




 Netlight strives to be a truly diverse, equitable and inclusive organization. Regardless of who you are, what personality, background, and experience you have, you enrich our culture through your values. Netlight’s purpose is to unleash full potential, realize great careers, and fulfill personal growth. To achieve this, we have a highly engaged network organization, where every employee gets a mentor, delivery coach and personal communities. The key to our continued success is trust and personal responsibility, diverse experiences, challenging opportunities and developing from personal values. Every Netlighter is an active part of building and shaping this culture, which leads to a clear correlation between personal growth and the growth of Netlight.
 



  





**About us** 




 Netlight provides a full range of premium IT-consulting services at the forefront of the digital industry and stands out for its product- and technology-independent expertise in a wide range of industries and clients. We are a network organization of more than 2 000 role models making aspiring digital leaders successful in their business-critical IT projects. Netlight has been awarded several times as top employer, as well as for growth, continued profitability and engagement for diversity, equity and equality within the IT industry. Today we are growing all across Europe, currently with more than 13 active international offices.
 



  





**What does it mean to be an IT Consultant in Software Development at Netlight?** 




 It will vary a lot between Netlighters as we, around the right person, will design a role together with you. You will be starting somewhere familiar. For example in web development? System development? Mobile Development? Data engineering? It is your call how your career at Netlight will look, ranging from which clients you will work with, what role you want to take (based on your personal experience, strengths, your personal interest) and how your relationship with your mentor/coach/EDGE networks/social networks will look like.
 



  





 As a consultant at Netlight, you will build the products, systems and technical solutions of today and tomorrow. This means that our consultants get the opportunity to help build and scale existing and new products and companies and also continuously learn and master a variety of technical tools. At Netlight, we will challenge you. Our clients will challenge you. You will challenge our clients. You will challenge us. We will grow together and unleash the potential in each other.
 



  





 Our projects are in the fields such as Backend Development, Frontend Development, Web Development, System Development, Cloud, Mobile Development, Architecture, Business Intelligence, Data Engineering, Data Science, DevOps, Infrastructure, Cyber Security, Scrum Master, Agile Coaching, Product Owner, UX-/UI-/Interaction Design and more.
 



  





**Minimum Qualifications** 



* Master Degree in Engineering or Technology
* Verbal and written fluency in English
* 0,5-5 years of work experience related to IT



  





**Preferred Qualifications** 



* Proven Track-record from previous positions (e.g. recognized achievements & deliveries)
* Advanced/Bilingual (B2-C2) Swedish/Norwegian/Danish



  





**Application** 




 We are always looking for new Netlighters, so feel free to apply if you meet the qualifications. We try to get in touch within two weeks
 
 if
 
 we find that your profile and experiences are a match beyond the qualifications at this time.

title: Software Developer
description:
TRATON is a group of strong brands with a shared mission: transforming transportation together to create the future of sustainable transport solutions. Within TRATON, we include MAN, Scania, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Together, we have the power to transform transportation.
   

  

 Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do.
   

  

 We are seeking a skilled Software Developer with 3+ years of experience, focusing on development of test- and integration solutions for automotive and embedded software applications. This role requires strong problem-solving skills, collaboration in cross-functional teams, and the ability to work in a dynamic environment.
   

  

**About Us**
 VTAB (Virtual Truck and Bus) is a cutting-edge Software-in-the-Loop (SIL) simulation platform developed in-house at Scania and used across the TRATON Group. VTAB enables high-fidelity, closed loop testing of complex embedded systems software integrated with a wide range of vehicle models, all executed on an engineering laptop or in the Cloud.
   

  

 We believe in transforming vehicle software development by bringing simulation to the forefront. Our vision is to provide every engineer in the TRATON ecosystem with accessible, scalable, and reliable simulation tools from early design to validation and release.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Build and maintain robust SW testing frameworks and test environments to support development of complex SW systems and embedded solutions
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate and configure software for automotive ECU applications
* Maintain and improve version control and development workflows, ensuring CI/CD pipelines run reliably and efficiently


**Key Competence**
* Python: Strong proficiency in Python with hands-on experience developing backend systems
* Git (GitLab): Solid understanding of version control principles using Git, with hands-on experience in GitLab (or similar platforms)
* SW testing and test environments: Practical knowledge of test platforms/test environments tailored for embedded and/or automotive systems
* CI experience: Proven experience building and maintaining Continuous Integration (CI) pipelines


**Valuable Skills**
* AWS: Familiarity with cloud services for scalable infrastructure, storage, and deployment
* Dockers: Knowledge of containerization for simplifying deployment and ensuring consistency across environments
* Linux: Proficiency in working with Linux environments for development, testing, and deployment
* C/C++: Experience in developing efficient, low-level applications and understanding embedded systems programming
* Simulink experience: Ability to use Simulink for model-based design, simulation, and validation of control systems
* Automotive applications (ECU integrations and configuration): Understanding of automotive software design, integration and configuration processes for Electronic Control Units (ECUs)


**Your Environment**
 Joining the VTAB team means stepping into a collaborative, fast-moving R&D environment. You’ll work alongside developers, test engineers, system designers, and domain experts from across the TRATON Group in an agile environment.
   

  

 We're continuously improving our platform and practices — and we invite you to be part of this journey.
   

  

**We Offer**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, TRATON Group R&D supports your career growth both locally and internationally. Benefits include wellness allowance, TRATON result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. We also host events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes. Apply as soon as possible. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role. If you have questions or would like more information, please contact: frida.stam@scania.com.
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

title: Backend Developer
description:
NoA Ignite is a leading design and technology company that seamlessly blends business insight with engineering craftsmanship to create innovative digital solutions. With a team of over 400 digital strategists, designers, technologists, and data experts across offices in the Nordics and Poland, we are dedicated to delivering meaningful and measurable results for our clients.
 



  





 Today, we're thrilled to offer a chance for you to join our team as our new Backend Developer!
 



  





  





**About the role** 




 As a Backend Developer at NoA Ignite, you'll collaborate with clients and fellow team members to create, maintain, and improve top-quality products.
 



  





 You will work with a modern, scalable technology stack, including backend development in Node.js with TypeScript, and frontend/mobile development in an Nx monorepo with React Native. Our applications run on Kubernetes on the Google Cloud Platform (GCP), with infrastructure managed as code using Terraform. Continuous integration and delivery are handled through GitHub Actions and Bitrise.
 



  





  





**What we are looking for** 




 We prioritize finding individuals who share our values and are eager to learn and grow with us. This approach allows us to build a team that is not only talented and capable but also passionate and committed to our shared goals.
 



 You are an inclusive colleague and a true team player. You love what you do and take pride in writing clean and testable code, experimenting with new technologies, and always trying to improve. You look forward to working with your talented colleagues to build and maintain our client's products and to learn from their experiences.
 



  





  





**Skills & background** 




 · Experienced in utilizing services such as push notifications, Firebase, cloud-based storage solutions, App Store/Google Play integration, and more.
 



 · Expertise in Node.js, knowledge in React Native and Typescript.
 



 · Comfortable working in a complex architecture and solving technical challenges.
 



 · Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.
 



 · Ability to communicate ideas effectively and interpret the ideas of others.
 



 · Familiarity with development tools such as Git.
 



 · Proactive problem solver with attention to detail.
 



  





  





**Recruitment process** 




 Interested? Get in touch! We are meeting applicants on an ongoing basis. There is no need for a personal letter or a CV. Just provide a link to your LinkedIn profile and that's it!

title: Salesforce Technical Specialist
description:
**Role:** 
 Salesforce Technical Specialist
 



**Experience (Years):** 
 15-20 years
 



**Language requirement:** 
 Swedish & English
 



  





**Tata consultancy Services** 
 is an IT services, consulting and business solutions organization that has been partnering with many of the world’s largest businesses for the past 50 years. We believe innovation and collective knowledge can transform all our futures with greater purpose. We help companies across industries achieve their strategic goals and lead their digital transformation programs. With 600,000 experts globally and 18,000+ consultants working for leading Nordic Customers, we have a strong sense of purpose for the ecosystem around us – our employees, partners, customers and society.
 



  





**Role Summary:** 




  





 The Salesforce Technical Specialist will be responsible for architecting, implementing, and supporting Salesforce-based digital transformation programs across industries including Telecom, retail, consumer goods, distribution, travel, hospitality, Life Sciences, Manufacturing, and Financial Services in the Nordic region. The role requires deep expertise in Salesforce Core Cloud Platforms (Sales, Service) and advanced customization using Apex/Lightning, and strong integration skills with enterprise systems. The candidate will be expected to lead solution design, ensure delivery excellence, and collaborate closely with business and IT stakeholders to drive measurable outcomes.
 



  





**Required Experience** 




  




* 8–12 years of total IT experience in Salesforce ecosystem and overall, 15-20 years of experience
* Proven track record in architecting and implementing Salesforce solutions for enterprise-scale clients.
* Expertise in Apex, Lightning Web Components (LWC), Integration (REST/SOAP, Mulesoft), and CI/CD (Copado/Jenkins).
* Hands-on experience in Agile delivery and DevOps environments.
* Strong communication and stakeholder management skills with Nordic or European client exposure.



  





  





**Key Responsibilities** 




  





  





**Portfolio Management** 




  




* Manage a portfolio of Salesforce transformation engagements across multiple Nordic clients.
* Ensure all programs align with enterprise architecture standards, scalability, and best practices.
* Track delivery health, risks, and dependencies across multiple initiatives.



  





**Solutions and Relationship Management** 




  




* Lead technical solutioning during RFPs and client workshops; define architectures, prototypes, and demos.
* Engage with C-level stakeholders to identify business pain points and translate them into scalable Salesforce solutions.
* Support pre-sales with estimation, solution documentation, and proposal development.



  





  





**Delivery Governance** 




  




* Drive high-quality delivery through technical governance, design reviews, and performance audits.
* Mentor and guide offshore/nearshore teams to maintain consistency in development and configuration practices.
* Ensure compliance with security, GDPR, and integration standards specific to the Nordic markets.



  





  





**Qualifications** 




  




* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, Information Systems, or related discipline.
* Salesforce Certified Application Architect or System Architect (mandatory).
* Additional certifications (e.g., Platform Developer II, Integration Architect, Industries CPQ Specialist-desirable)



  





  





**Does that sound interesting?** 




  





 You are welcome to submit your application consisting of your CV, personal letter, relevant degrees or certifications details, professional references, etc. We work with ongoing recruitment so send in your application as soon as possible.
 



  





 We look forward to receiving your application via LinkedIn or mail to
 **aswini.ranganathan@tcs.com** 




  





**Privacy Note: https://ibegin.tcs.com/iBegin/privacy-notice**

title: Senior Business Developer
description:
**⚡️ What We Do**
 Flower is Flexible Power. We are a next-gen energy company leveraging AI and machine learning to make renewable energy stable and always available – even when the sun isn’t shining and the wind isn’t blowing.
   

  

 Through smart optimization and trading of energy assets like wind and solar farms, battery systems, and EV chargers, we make renewable energy reliable and predictable, leading the charge towards the energy system of tomorrow.
   

  

**🌟Who We Are**
 Tech company at heart. Purpose-driven at core. Flower consists of a diverse group of innovative individuals with a strong desire to improve the state of the world.
   

  

 At Flower, we believe trust, collaboration and diversity are essential to not only create an inclusive work environment, but also drive career growth. By embracing varying perspectives, we allow creativity and progress to flourish.
   

  

 To accelerate towards our goal of becoming the pioneering force powering the energy system of tomorrow, we are now looking for a passionate and skilled Senior Business Developer.
   

  

**👩‍💻 About The Role**
 You will play a key commercial role in scaling Flower’s Distributed Assets business by leading partnerships across retailers, BRPs, OEMs, and other asset-enabling partners within the flexibility market. You will drive the full commercial process from initial outreach to signed agreements, while shaping how partners adopt and integrate Flower’s flexibility offering. This role combines strategic influence with hands-on execution and is central to unlocking partner-driven capacity growth required for Flower’s long-term success.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Lead commercial engagements with retailers, BRPs, OEMs, and other asset-enabling partners within the flexibility market.
* Manage the full lifecycle from first contact to signed partnership agreement
* Build and maintain a high-quality commercial pipeline
* Influence partner decision-makers and strategic direction
* Identify and develop new business opportunities that strengthen the Distributed Assets portfolio
* Collaborate closely with internal teams (Product, Tech, Partner Success, Trading) to ensure smooth onboarding and long-term success
* Represent Flower externally and position our flexibility offering in the market


**Who You Are**
* An experienced commercial professional with 8+ years in business development, partnerships, or B2B sales
* Relevant academic background, such as a degree in engineering, economics, business, or a related field.
* Skilled in managing complex stakeholder landscapes and long commercial cycles
* Able to translate strategic goals into concrete commercial actions
* Confident engaging with senior decision-makers on both strategic and operational topics
* Experience in the energy sector, utilities, or related industries is a strong advantage
* Fluent in both Swedish and English, with strong written and verbal communication skills.


**📍 Location**
 Our beautiful office is located in the heart of Södermalm just a short walk from Slussen subway station. We encourage in-office collaboration but support a hybrid work model.
   

  

**✉️ Apply**
 Our corporate language is English, as we have over 30 nationalities in the office. We therefore appreciate it if you could submit your CV in English.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

*We kindly but firmly decline any engagement in recruitment assistance for our hiring processes. This includes partnership offers or the sale of recruitment tools.*

title: Game Capture Artist
description:
* Introduction.


 As a Game Capture Artist at Paradox you are in charge of organizing and executing game capture projects - from getting beta codes to editing the captured gameplay. You are expected to plan your upcoming project, work with audio, motion graphics as well as coordinate with your team and stakeholders. You will work with different types of material, gameplay capture as well as pre recorded video footage. You are also expected to deliver all the different end formats required per video, communicate and book external expertise if needed.
   

  

* Goals and KPIs


 You Are To Ensure Video Productions Are Completed On Deadline, Uphold The Quality Expected As Well As Fit Into The Original Scope And Budget. You Strive To Understand The Purpose Of The Videos And Make Sure The Outcome Is The Best Solution To Fit Into The Objectives And Goals Set By You And Your Stakeholders. You Are Proactive And Help Your Stakeholders To Further Enhance The Experience Of The Videos As Well As Come Up With Ideas To Help Reach Your Stakeholders Goals Short- And Long-term. Your Goals Are Often Set By PMM And/or BO But You Still Have Goals And KPIs Of Your Own That Include But Are Not Limited To
   

  

* Right quality for the purpose of the game play video
* Efficiency - both economical and work wise
* Being on top of the latest builds to capture from
* Creating smooth gameplay in high resolution..


 The KPIs used to measure this include but are not limited to
   

  

* Stakeholder satisfaction
* Gameplay trailers created with great quality
* YouTube video retention
* Relevant gameplay to the topic of the video


**Relationships**
 As a Game Capture Artist you report to the Head of Marketing Creative. You will have a tight relationship with your colleagues in the Marketing Creative Team. You need to have a close relationship with the PMM and the Game Developer as those will often be your stakeholders and source of information.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Responsibilities include but are not limited to:


 Ensuring the right quality of gameplay capture productions
   

  

* Uphold a strong stakeholder relationship
* Proactively work with all Paradox Studios.
* Strive to be efficient in everything you do
* Work with creating long and short format videos, trailers, adverts.
* Uphold a good pre-production, production and post production workflow
* Deliver on time and on budget


**Qualifications**
* Proven experience in working with recording software as well as editing software
* Technical skills in post production software, for video editing, graphics, audio, color and mastering.
* Experience in working with video content designed for social media, streaming platforms
* Excellent communication and organizational skills
* Work with especially editing for trailers, paid media ads, short and long format videos, for YouTube and other social media platforms
* Help produce and being organizer for sales etc. (Publisher Week, Summer Sale etc.)
* Establish Post Production workflow in team and help set standards for deliveries

title: Strategic Business Developer
description:
**Strategic Business Developer – Green Industry Transformation**
 The green industrial transition is driving a historic transformation of society and industry, creating significant value economically,technologicallyand environmentally. NCC Green Industry Transformation plays a key role in enabling this transition through large,complexand strategically important industrial and infrastructure projects across the Nordics.
   

  

 We are now looking for a
 **Strategic Business Developer** 
 who wants to be at the forefront of identifying,shapingand developing new business opportunities that support NCC’s long-term growth and profitability.
   

  

**The RoleAndKey Responsibilities**
 AsStrategicBusiness Developer within NCC Green Industry Transformation, you will have a central role in realizing the strategy for the business area by identifyingand developing business opportunities. You will work closely with senior management and key stakeholders across the business area as well as the whole of NCC, combining strong analytical capabilities with a pragmatic, hands-on approach.
   

  

 The role includes driving strategic initiatives, developing businesscasesand supporting managers with fact-based decision-making. You act as a trusted advisor in both business and construction-related matters andcontribute activelyin detailing and driving the strategic development of Business Area Green Industry Transformation.
   

  

 The positionislocatedinLuleå, Solna, Malmö or Göteborg,travelsto other offices in thebusiness areaisrequiredas part of the job – from time to time, the travel can be significant.
   

  

**Youwill**
* Identifyexisting and new market segments with strong potential for NCC and assess their attractiveness
* Develop and execute approaches to transformidentifiedsegments into attractive projects for NCCGreen industry Transformation, quantifying potential and building networks in- and outside the company for NCC to successfully capture these opportunities
* Drive anddeliverdefinedbusiness opportunities, from market understanding to concrete project opportunities
* Build andmaintainstrong networks with strategy and operational development managers across NCC’s business areas
* Coach and support managers in: Business case formulation, fact-based and quantitative analysis
* Prepare and present decision material, analyses and recommendations to Business Area management, CEO, Senior Management Team,Boardand external stakeholders


**Your Experience And Background**
 We believe you have experiencefromroles such as strategic business development, management consulting, commercialdevelopmentor similar positions within the construction or industrial sector, combined with solid hands-on experience from construction projects. You are able to contribute with construction-related and technical solutions, understand project delivery and translate customer needs into feasible, value-adding concepts for NCC.
   

  

 You are a confident and analytical professional with strong business acumen and the ability to influence and engage stakeholders at all levels of the organization. You combine strategic thinking with execution power and thrive in complex environments where not all data is readily available.
   

  

* Academic level equaling a MSc
* Minimum 5 years of experience from the construction industry
* Fluent in English and at least one of the Nordic languages


**Requestedqualifications**
* Broad understanding of construction contracts and project setups (AB contracts, negotiation, delivery models)
* Strong analytical and hypothesis-driven problem-solving skills
* Excellent presentation andcommunicationskills
* Coaching andpedagogicalcapabilities
* An enthusiastic, outgoing personality – able to be “tough with a smile”
* Driver's license B


**You Lead And Act In Line WithNCC Star Behaviors**
*Passion to perform,Buildtogether, Follow through and follow up, Act with care.*
 Background checks are conductedin accordance withNCC’s security culture.
   

  

**About The Business Area – NCC Green Industry Transformation**
 NCC Green Industry Transformation is a newly established business area focusing on large-scale, complex industrial and infrastructure projects within the green transition. The business area delivers projects in the SEK billion range and plays a key role in enabling fossil-free and sustainable industrial development across the Nordics.
   

  

**NCC offers**
 At NCC, we strive to be an attractive employer where employees thrive,developand feel well. We offer a wide range of employee benefits and have collective agreements that provide security and clear employment conditions. You will also have access to insurance, wellness allowance, reduced workinghoursandadditionalbenefits through our benefits portal.
   

  

**Contact and application**
 For questions about the recruitment process, please contact
   

  

 Recruitment Specialist Nathalie Löfvenmark, nathalie.lofvenmark@ncc.se, +46 72 235 30 23
   

  

 Selectionisongoingand the position may be filled before the application deadline.
   

  

**Welcomewithyour application!**
**Build with us and get the best colleagues in the industry**
 At NCC, we are driven to continuously develop – whether it concerns our construction projects or our personal expertise. Every day, we move the industry’s most exciting and complex projects forward through close collaboration between employees, partners and customers. With us, you are a key contributor to the landmarks that define our cities and communities.
   

  

 Here, our employees take an active role in a corporate culture based on stable values and behaviors for a safe and secure workplace. Our collective expertise and diverse backgrounds make a difference.
   

  

**NCC – one of the leading construction companies in the Nordics**
**We kindly but firmly decline contact from advertisers and providers of recruitment services.**

title: AI Developer
description:
**Vill du bygga AI som gör skillnad på riktigt?** 




  





**Har du några års erfarenhet av systemutveckling och vill nu lägga all din kraft på att skapa lösningar där AI möter mänskliga behov?** 




**Vi på OMAI söker en nyfiken och driven utvecklare som vill vara med och bygga vår tekniska själ från start.** 




  





**Om OMAI** 




 Vi är en strategisk partner som gör AI mänskligt. Vi ser att tekniken går fort, men många företag fastnar i hypen. OMAI finns för att bygga broar mellan strategi, teknik och människa. Vi hjälper våra kunder att gå från idé till faktiska lösningar i produktion – alltid med människan i centrum. Nu behöver vi dig som vill omsätta teknisk spets till praktisk nytta.
 



  





**Rollen** 




**Ditt fokus kommer vara att:** 



* **Bygga och implementera:** 
 Utveckla AI-lösningar, RAG-system, data pipelines och smarta automatiseringar via API:er.
* **Skapa struktur:** 
 Ta fram tekniska ramverk och verktyg som gör vår leverans skalbar och träffsäker.
* **Lösa problem:** 
 Jobba nära våra kunder i projekt för att snabbt gå från teori till fungerande mjukvara.
* **Vara en brygga:** 
 Hjälpa till att kommunicera tekniska möjligheter på ett begripligt sätt, både internt och mot kund.



  





**Vem är du?** 




 Vi söker en "byggare" med helhetsförståelse. Du har förmodligen jobbat minst två år med systemutveckling samt utforskat olika AI-lösningar.
 



  





**Vi tror att du har:** 



* God erfarenhet av systemutveckling (gärna Python, TypeScript eller liknande).
* Intresse för eller erfarenhet av LLM-lösningar, automatisering och cloudmiljöer (Azure/AWS/GCP).
* En prestigelös inställning – du gillar att bygga, testa och lära dig nya saker längs vägen.
* Ett öga för kvalitet och ordning (SQL, API-design och dokumentation).
* En vilja att förstå kundens affär och utmaningar.



  





**Varför OMAI?** 




 OMAI står vid startlinjen av något stort. Hos oss får du chansen att vara med tidigt och påverka hur vi jobbar. Vi är ett team som tror på transparens, empati och att vi lär oss bäst tillsammans. Du får en miljö där din energi och din vilja att bygga betyder mer än hur långt ditt CV är.
 



**Låter det som du?** 
 Hör av dig till mig så tar vi ett snack online eller över en kaffe.
 



  





 Jag ser fram emot att höra vad du brinner för!

title: Group Product Manager - Backstage
description:
Originally conceived in Spotify, Backstage is now a leading SaaS and open source platform for building developer portals. Backed by many firms, Backstage assists in coordinating microservices and infrastructure, enabling teams to deliver outstanding code amidst AI advancements.
   

  

 About the position: We are looking for a creative, passionate, and experienced Product Leader to join our Backstage Product Area in Spotify.
   

  

 Our mission at Backstage is to unleash creativity and innovation for developers in the age of AI, while creating delightful experiences. Through the last couple of years, Backstage has enabled thousands of organizations, including fortune 100 companies, to shift and transform their engineering culture, creating centralized software catalog, standards and accelerate AI adoption and effectiveness with our different offerings: Open source, plugins and SaaS products.
   

  

 Guide product managers, coordinate our SaaS product, work in an agile startup environment, and aid product expansion.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Guide the improvement of our key product user experience with mixed teams.
* Manage a team of product managers, mentor, guide and scale the team impact.
* Develop a comprehensive strategy and vision for the product, aligning with the overall business goals.
* Lead the creation and execution of the product roadmap, ensuring that it aligns with the strategic vision and addresses customer needs.
* Prioritize features and make data-driven decisions based on market research, user feedback, and performance metrics.
* Communicate effectively with partners, including executives, cross-functional teams, and customers, to ensure alignment and consensus.
* Engage closely, and create processes for the team to collaborate successfully with cross-functional teams like sales, marketing, design, user-research and insights


 Who You Are
   

  

* You have significant experience in building and shipping customer-facing software products together with teams of designers, engineers and data scientists.
* You have 10+ years of experience in product management roles
* You have experience of being a group product manager of a SaaS B2B product
* You have shown experience in scaling product portfolio, serving hundreds of customers
* You are passionate about developer experience and have a deep understanding of the developer journey, jobs to be done for a developer or DevOps/Infra teams.
* You have deep experience in making hard data-informed decisions (A/B experimentation, customer feedback, user testing, data analysis, competitors and market analysis, defining metrics)
* You are excited about working in a new, fast-paced and innovative space and are passionate about the opportunity to make developers tasks delightful and efficient.
* You’re a compelling storyteller who can communicate in succinct and inspiring ways to a variety of audience types
* You apply systems thinking and analytical expertise to develop product strategies
* You are comfortable working with distributed teams across multiple offices and timezones
* Background in platform engineering
* Background and experience as a developer


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in Stockholm, Sweden or London, United Kingdom.
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! You should expect some level of requisite amount of in-person engagements with a hybrid working approach.


 We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us. Find our AI notice here: https://lifeatspotify.com/ai-notice
   

  

 Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Developer
description:
Want to build reliable solutions that make an impact for millions of readers? At Aller Media Tech, we build platforms that support some of the strongest media brands in the Nordics.
   

  

 We’re looking for a developer to join our Product Platform area and help build the platform behind Aller Media’s news sites. Ship fast, server-rendered experiences with great performance, clean HTML/CSS, and JavaScript.
   

  

 This role suits someone who likes simple, durable technology choices, enjoys solving hard problems close to the fundamentals, and wants their work to be felt by millions of readers.
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

 You’ll join a Nordic media company with strong brands and real societal impact. You’ll work in product-oriented teams with clear ownership, pragmatic decision-making, and room to influence how we build. We value learning, psychological safety, and collaboration across disciplines.
   

  

 Aller Media offers exciting technical challenges, knowledge sharing, and a strong focus on personal and professional development with great colleagues. We offer competitive benefits, including pension, health insurance, and flexibility.
   

  

 What you’ll work on
   

  

 Your work will span the full stack, including:
   

  

* Building and evolving server-rendered experiences in Node.js/Express
* Working with HTTP, caching strategies, and CDN/edge capabilities (e.g., edge workers)
* Writing semantic HTML and modern, framework-independent CSS
* Implementing interactive features with functional, framework-free JavaScript
* Optimizing client-side performance (Core Web Vitals, loading strategies, rendering cost)
* Ensuring accessibility and inclusive design in everyday development
* Experience from display advertising, video, or media environments is a plus, but not required.


 Where will you be located?
   

  

 Your office location is either Stockholm, Oslo, or Copenhagen.
   

  

 Regardless of office affiliation, occasional travel will be required to collaborate with people across Denmark, Sweden, Finland, and Norway. The team has an office-first policy with flexibility.
   

  

 Ready to apply?
   

  

 Please note that this position is within Aller Media Nordic, by clicking apply for this position you will be redirected to the Aller Media Nordic career page. The application deadline is
 **February 10th** 
 . Please submit your CV and respond to the questions using the link below.
   

  

 Only applications submitted via the link will be considered. We conduct interviews on an ongoing basis and may close the posting once the right candidate is found. If you have questions about the position, please reach out to Head of Product Platform Pelin Gottfredsen on pelin.gottfredsen@aller.com.
   

  

 We are looking forward to hearing from you!

title: Systemutvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Ska-krav:**
* Erfarenhet av att designa och bygga arkitektur som binder ihop front-end och backend-tjänster.
* Utveckling och arkitektur: Java, Spring Boot, API-utveckling, relationsdatabaser.
* Kunskap om molnteknik och infrastruktur: Azure PaaS, IaC, Kubernetes/Docker.
* Erfarenhet av DevOps/CI/CD, automatisering och dokumentation.
* Förmåga att leda tekniska initiativ, stötta teamet och coacha andra utvecklare.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i en skalad agil miljö (t.ex. SAFe eller motsvarande).
* Erfarenhet av .net


**Meriterande:**
* Betallösningar (t.ex. Swish, Paynova).
* Data och molntjänster (PostgreSQL, KQL, Azure PaaS).
* Test och metoder (JUnit, Cucumber, OSDM).


**Sista ansökningdag: 20-01-2026**
**Om Oss**
 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Här påverkar du din egen lön som helt och hållet som baseras på ditt timpris mot kund.
   

  

 Vår lönemodell är en hybridlösning mellan en fast månadslön och en provisionsbaserad ersättning. Det innebär att din månadslön baseras på ditt timpris, fast om du mot förmodan skulle stå utan uppdrag så behåller du en grund lön fram tills vi hittat ett nytt uppdrag, bra va?
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

* Erfarenhet av molnbaserade integrationer i Azure (API Management, Functions, Service Bus/Event Grid, Key Vault, RBAC, Monitoring)

Du är en lagspelare som uppskattar att arbeta tillsammans med andra, samtidigt som du trivs med att ta ansvar och driva frågor framåt.
