title: Data Analyst - People Analytics
description:
**Job Description**

**What You'll Do**
  

 As Data Analyst within People Analytics, you’ll support data-informed decision-making across the people life cycle by delivering reliable reporting, analysis and insights. This is a hands-on role where you’ll be driving the full analytical life cycle, from understanding business questions and forming hypotheses through development, data analysis, and actionable insights and recommendations. You’ll work closely with a cross-functional team of other Data Analysts, Product Managers, People Insight Specialists and HR Process Owners to ensure people data is accessible, trusted and actionable with the goal of enabling impactful people decisions across the H&M Group.
   

  





**Key Responsibilities:**



* Partner with Product Management, People Analytics and HR stakeholders to understand needs and translate those into clear analytical approaches.
* Deliver end-to-end people analytics from data extraction and analysis to insight, visualization and recommendations.
* Build and maintain dashboards and reports in Power BI that track people metrics such as workforce composition, hiring, retention, engagement and more.
* Identify and analyze trends and patterns in people data to support both operational and strategic decision-making.
* Ensure data quality and consistency by validating, documenting and improving people data, dashboards and metrics.



  

  

**Who You'll Work With**
  

 As a Data Analyst, you’ll be part of our digital HR team that’s responsible for digital solutions that enable and support people processes across the H&M Group. You’ll collaborate with HR experts and senior leaders across central and regional functions, Product Managers, People Insights Specialists, Data Analysts, as well as vendor partners and technical teams in cyber security and AI/AD, alongside legal and compliance teams. Together, you’ll turn people and data needs into clear, usable and trusted solutions that create business value.
   

  

  

  

**Who You Are**
  

 We’re looking for people with...
   

  




* Several years of experience working as a Data Analyst or in a similar analytical role within data, analytics, or HR.
* A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Analytics, Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Business, or a related field.
* Strong analytical skills and experience working with large datasets.
* Solid and hands-on experience creating dashboards and visualizations in tools such as Power BI, Tableau or similar.
* Experience extracting and transforming data from data warehouses or similar data sources.
* Ability to turn complex analysis into clear insights and recommendations.
* Experience working in complex, global organizations.



 And people who are...
   

  




* Strong in problem-solving with an ability to frame business issues and needs into analytical questions and translate findings into practical recommendations.
* Hands-on in discovery, using dialogue, feedback and insight to understand needs.
* Clear communicator who works efficiently across business and technical teams.
* Comfortable taking ownership of data, identifying patterns and proactively surfacing insights and opportunities.



 It’s a plus if you have...
   

  




* Knowledge of statistical methods and experience with SQL, Python or R.
* Exposure to data mesh, sustainability or regulatory reporting.
* Experience with HR systems (e.g. SAP SuccessFactors).


**Additional Information**

**Who We Are**




 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  





 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  





 This role is based out of Stockholm, Sweden. For this role are unable to provide relocation assistance or visa sponsorship. Applicants must have existing work authorization for the country in which the role is located.
   

  





**Why You'll Love Working Here**




 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories and ARKET. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  





**Join Us**




 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  





 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  





 \*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: Business Analyst
description:
As a Business Analyst, you will analyse the business domain and optimise business performance through the effective application of technology. You will work closely with stakeholders and cross-functional teams to ensure that business needs are correctly translated into high-quality, scalable IT solutions.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Elicit, analyse, document, prioritise, and validate business and solution requirements
* Prepare and maintain Software Requirement Specifications (SRS)
* Organise and facilitate workshops (on-site and online)
* Conduct feasibility studies and cost-benefit analyses
* Collaborate with system analysts, solution architects, developers, testers, and technical writers to ensure shared understanding and solution quality
* Produce and maintain business analysis artefacts, including:
+ Use cases
+ Requirements
+ Mock-ups
+ User stories
+ Data models

* Verify and validate requirements and manage requirements traceability
* Create and maintain models using Sparx Enterprise Architect
* Write user and system documentation
* Prepare and conduct user training
* Support testing activities by contributing to test plans and test cases
* Assist business users in structuring applications according to information architecture best practices
* Support the Project Manager and, when required, assume the role of Project Manager


**Requirements**
* Proven experience as a Business Analyst within IT solutions
* Strong experience with UML (Unified Modelling Language)
* Solid knowledge of business analysis techniques
* Up-to-date knowledge of the IT domain and emerging technologies
* Experience working with Agile and/or DevOps practices
* Strong analytical skills, including:
+ Synthesising large amounts of information
+ Problem-solving
+ Managing incomplete or conflicting requirements

* Strong communication skills, including presentation skills, targeted communication, and active listening
* Knowledge of business analysis best practices (e.g. BABOK)
* Understanding of GDPR
* Experience with:
+ Visual modelling and design tools (e.g. Sparx Enterprise Architect)
+ BPMN and/or ArchiMate
+ Work item management tools (e.g. Azure DevOps, TFS, Jira)

* Experience with project management


**Education And Professional Experience**
* University degree with minimum 4 years of experience in IT OR
* Non-university degree with minimum 7 years of experience in IT
* Minimum 3 years of hands-on experience in business analysis


****Certification****
* Mandatory: CBAP (Certified Business Analyst Professional) or equivalent third-party certification


**Benefits**
**Why join inventYOU**
* Opportunity to work on diverse and challenging consulting assignments
* Long-term collaboration with a supportive and people-focused consulting company
* Flexibility in assignment setup (hybrid or on-site, depending on project)
* Professional growth through exposure to modern technologies and industries
* Dedicated support throughout your consulting journey

title: Information Technology Consultant
description:
**Vill du vara med och forma tekniska lösningar – istället för att bara leverera dem?** 




  





 Hos oss på MissionPoint söker vi nu fler rådgivare till området
 **Tech** 
 . Vi kallar den här rollen för Technical Advisor och här arbetar du med att
 **analysera, designa och kvalitetssäkra** 
 tekniska miljöer för våra kunder – alltid utifrån deras bästa, inte leverantörens. Vi är en
 **oberoende partner** 
 som hjälper medelstora företag med IT-styrning och IT-ledning som tjänst.
 



  





 Som Technical Advisor har du en nyckelroll i MissionPoints konsultmodell, där
 **du driver det tekniska värdet i kundleveransen.** 




  





**Vad du får hos oss** 



* En roll där du utvecklas från teknikleverans till teknisk rådgivning och arkitektur
* Möjlighet att fördjupa dig i Microsoft 365, Azure, hybridlösningar och modern workplace
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med hela kedjan – från nulägesanalys till arkitektur och implementation
* Ett team av rådgivare som tillsammans levererar IT-ledning och IT Advisory
* En kultur där vi lär av varandra och bygger lösningar tillsammans



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som rådgivare inom Tech blir du den som hjälper kunderna att förstå och förbättra sina tekniska miljöer. Du analyserar nuläge, identifierar risker och möjligheter, och översätter affärskrav till tekniska lösningar.
 



  





**Exempel på typiska uppgifter** 



* Agera tekniskt bollplank till IT-chefen och ansvara för arkitektur inom ramen för IT Management
* Agera arkitekt och kvalitetssäkrare i tekniska projekt
* Säkerställa teknisk leveranskvalitet, säkerhet och arkitekturmål (Typiska KPI:er)
* Arbeta med kravställning, analys och problemlösning kring kunders IT-strategi och operativt i planering och projekt
* Driva teknisk proaktivitet och leverantörsstyrning (t.ex. change)
* Genomföra nuläges- och behovsanalyser hos nya kunder



  





**Vi tror att du har** 



* Erfarenhet av Microsoft-ekosystemet (M365, Azure, hybridlösningar)
* Intresse för kravställning, arkitektur och teknisk kvalitetssäkring
* Erfarenhet inom ett specifikt IT-område som du kan bidra med expertis inom
* En nyfikenhet på automation, effektivisering och optimering av IT-miljöer
* Förmåga att kommunicera med både tekniker och verksamhet för att översätta affärskrav till teknik



  





*Det är meriterande om du har eftergymnasial utbildning inom relevant område och/eller erfarenhet av att arbeta med IT-styrningsmodeller, informationssäkerhet och riskhantering.*

title: Technical Support Engineer
description:
**Responsibilities:** 




  




* Provide phone and email based problem solving and fault finding support for installers and customers
* Generating cases via CRM to track and resolve customer enquiries

 :**

title: Verksamhetsutvecklare IT
description:
**W5 Solutions är en ledande leverantör av avancerade system och lösningar för försvar, säkerhet och samhällsskydd. Vi stödjer svenska och internationella myndigheter samt industriella aktörer med teknologier och tjänster som stärker operativ förmåga inom våra tre affärsområden
 *Training* 
 ,
 *Power* 
 , och
 *Integration* 
 .**
**Genom ett starkt fokus på innovation, kvalitet och hållbarhet levererar vi skräddarsydda lösningar som möter högt ställda krav i kritiska miljöer. Vår verksamhet bygger på lång erfarenhet, teknisk expertis och ett starkt engagemang för våra kunders långsiktiga framgång.**
**Om rollen**
 Som Verksamhetsutvecklare IT blir du en central aktör i vår tillväxtresa. Du kommer ansvara för våra ERP och BI-system i koncernen och säkerställa att vi har rätt systemflora och integrationer, alltid med ett koncernperspektiv där beslut vägs mellan vad som är bäst för helheten och vad som fungerar lokalt. W5 har en stark försvärvstrategi och du kommer att analysera och avgöra om och hur system ska integreras eller bytas ut vid företagsförvärv. Rollen är både strategisk och operativ – du får möjlighet att påverka på hög nivå samtidigt som du driver konkreta projekt som gör skillnad.
   

  

**Vem vi söker**
* Har erfarenhet av ERP-system, gärna Monitor ERP.
* Är van vid BI-verktyg och datavisualisering.
* Har förståelse för affärsprocesser och gillar att omsätta krav till lösningar.
* Trivs med att leda workshops och driva projekt i en dynamisk miljö.


**Vad vi erbjuder**
* En nyckelroll i ett företag med höga ambitioner och stark tillväxt.
* Möjlighet att påverka strategiska beslut och koncernens IT-struktur.
* En kultur som präglas av professionalism, innovation och samarbete – och där vi har roligt tillsammans.


 När du arbetar hos oss på W5 Solutions får du mer än bara ett jobb – du blir en del av ett sammanhang där din kompetens uppskattas och din utveckling prioriteras. Vi erbjuder en stimulerande arbetsmiljö med varierande och meningsfulla arbetsuppgifter, moderna tekniska lösningar och tydlig koppling till samhällsnytta.
   

  

 Hos oss får du möjlighet att växa både professionellt och personligt, arbeta nära engagerade och kunniga kollegor och bidra till projekt som verkligen gör skillnad. Vi värnar om gemenskap, balans mellan arbete och fritid samt en kultur där idéer uppmuntras och varje medarbetare är en viktig del av helheten.
   

  

 W5 Solutions är en attraktiv arbetsgivare för dig som söker en professionell miljö där din kompetens tas till vara och där du får möjlighet att bidra till samhällsviktig utveckling.
   

  

 Vi undanber oss kontakt från rekryteringsföretag och externa rekryterare gällande denna tjänst.

title: IT Support Technician (in-house)
description:
Are you a service-minded person who enjoys building trust and relations in a fast-growing environment? Do you have a passion for people and enjoy finding solutions for problems? Come & join our Tech IT team!
 



  





**COME WORK WITH US** 




 As a member of the IT Operations Team, you will be part of a Tech organisation and together, we will continuously improve IT to the next level in our global environment. The role contains a lot of responsibilities, such as providing our colleagues with IT equipment, troubleshooting different issues, and helping them by answering their questions about IT services and processes on site. You will also be part of creating value for the whole Netlight and building the IT Services on a global level and the local office as well.
 



  





 We have IT seated today in Stockholm, Munich, Hamburg and Oslo and you will always be supported by the rest of the team in our day-to-day work and improvements! In this role, you also have the possibility to learn and develop in different areas such as Programming, Project management etc. You have a big room to shape your own role and future!
 



  





**WHAT YOU WILL DO** 




 - Support our colleagues with IT related tasks and maintain IT environment.
 



 - Procurement, inventory, and installation of IT equipment.
 



 - Continuous improvement of our support level in all our offices.
 



 - Support, maintenance and improvement of our systems and services.
 



 - Handle IT orders for our new and current colleagues in the offices and supplier management.
 



  





**WHAT WE LOOK FOR** 




 As a person we think you are a do:er and a slick problem solver. You are not afraid of taking own initiatives and make them real. We also think that you have a big technical interest and are eager to develop those. You thrive in an environment where you can work independently and in team at the same time!
 



  





**QUALIFICATIONS** 




 - You are fluent and confident in spoken and written Swedish and English
 



 - Knowledge of MacOS, Windows, iOS, Android and Office365
 



 - Experience of Active directory and Azure
 



 - Interest and understanding for hardware and network setups
 



 - Meritorious with experience in PowerShell
 



  





**WHO WE ARE** 




 Netlight Consulting is an IT and Management consultancy company. We are a network organisation employing over 2000 talented individuals in Stockholm, Oslo, Helsinki, Copenhagen, Munich, Hamburg, Berlin, Frankfurt, Zurich, Amsterdam, Toronto, London, Madrid and Cologne. We have been awarded several times as top employer, as well as for our growth, continued profitability, and our engagement for equality within the IT industry.
 



  





**GET IN TOUCH WITH US!** 




 We are looking forward to your application, including your cover letter and resume!

title: Onsite IT-tekniker | Stockholm | Experis
description:
Är du en IT-tekniker som gillar att ta ansvar och lösa problem på plats? Vill du ha en roll där du är den självklara go-to personen för allt som rör IT - mitt i centrala Stockholm? Här får du chansen att arbeta hands-on med teknik, skapa smidiga lösningar och vara en nyckelperson i en dynamisk miljö.
   

  

 Som Onsite IT-tekniker blir du den lokala IT-resursen på ett nordiskt finansbolag i Stockholm. Du kommer att vara den som ser till att tekniken fungerar smidigt och att användarna får bästa möjliga support på plats. Här får du en varierande vardag där du hanterar allt från mötesrumsteknik till PC, Mac och Microsoft 365.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

* Support och underhåll av PC och Mac
* Hantering och felsökning av mötesrumsteknik
* Administration och support i Microsoft 365
* Installationer, uppgraderingar och hårdvaruhantering
* Kontakt med IT-teamet i Norden för status och samarbete


 Du arbetar självständigt på plats på Stockholmskontoret, men har alltid någon av dina kollegor i teamet att vända dig till för stöd, stöttning och kunskapsdelning. Några gånger per år reser du till vårt nordiska huvudkontor för att träffa teamet och stärka samarbetet.
   

  

 Det här är en roll för dig som:
   

  

* Är självgående och ansvarstagande
* Har en känsla för service och tycker om att hjälpa andra
* Gillar att lösa praktiska IT-utmaningar
* Vill utvecklas i en dynamisk miljö mitt i centrala Stockholm


 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Minst tre års erfarenhet som IT-tekniker eller liknande
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift
* Kunskap om PC, Mac och Microsoft 365


 Meriterande:
   

  

* Kunskap om nätverk och hårdvara
* Erfarenhet av ärendehanteringssystem och IT-säkerhet


 Vad erbjuder vi?
   

  

* En spännande och självständig roll i centrala Stockholm
* Möjlighet att utvecklas i en internationell miljö
* Resor till nordiskt huvudkontor ett par gånger per år
* Start i maj - men rekryteringsprocessen är igång redan nu!


**Vi ser framemot att höra från dig!**
 Låter detta som något för dig? Kontakta Dara på mailadress dara.tysani@se.experis.com för att höra mer om vad vi har att erbjuda!
   

  

 Om Experis
   

  

 Experis är ett ledande, globalt konsultbolag inom IT/Tech med över 600 konsulter på uppdrag i Sverige och 22 000 konsulter runt om i världen. Via Experis får du tillgång till en stor variation av spännande uppdrag hos våra intressanta kunder inom både privat och offentlig sektor. Du kan anta uppdrag genom ditt eget bolag eller som tillsvidareanställd konsult. På Experis blir du en i teamet och får tillgång till ett brett nätverk av kollegor inom ditt kompetensområde.
   

  

 På Experis får du en personlig konsultchef och kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling så att du kan hålla dig ajour med ny teknik. Experis, som är en del av ManpowerGroup, har ett långsiktigt hållbarhetsarbete (Working to change the world - ESG strategy) med målsättningen att bidra till att lösa kompetensbristen av bland annat IT-resurser.
   

  

**Vad kan vi erbjuda dig?**
 På Experis är vi stolta över våra konsulter och tillsammans hittar vi rätt utmaningar för dig. Vi har höga förväntningar på dig, men i gengäld erbjuder vi dig goda utvecklings- och karriärmöjligheter. Förutom möjligheten att utveckla dina kunskaper ute på spännande uppdrag erbjuds du provanställning enligt kollektivavtal, marknadsmässig månadslön, reglerad semester och semestersättning, friskvårdsbidrag, tjänstepension och försäkring, samt många andra förmåner - precis som det alltid ska vara
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Vi tar inte emot några ansökningar via mail men är det några frågor eller funderingar är du välkommen med de till dara.tysani@se.experis.com!

title: Social Media Specialist
description:
**Would you like to become a part of the World Of Red Bull?** 
 Do you naturally come up with creative, entertaining video ideas and know how to turn them into content people actually want to watch, share, and engage with?
   

  

 As a
 **Social Media Specialist** 
 , you help fuel the engine behind Red Bull Sweden’s digital content strategy. You’re an expert in your field — plugged into trends, platform mechanics, and user behavior, and you know what it takes to create content that cuts through.
   

  

 Based in Stockholm, your mission is to manage and grow our social media channels, activating everything from Red Bull events and sponsored athletes to live broadcasts, films, editorial content, and digital consumer activations. In short: you bring the brand to life where our audience is.
   

  

 Ready to take on the role of Social Media Specialist for one of the world’s strongest brands? Apply today — selection is ongoing.
   

  

**All the responsibilities we'll trust you with:**
**CONTENT CREATION**
 By proactively developing your own creative content initiatives, while also leveraging both local and global content opportunities, you use your creativity and video editing skills to ensure our channels are filled with engaging, up-to-date, and tailor-made video content that truly represents the brand.
   

  

**ORGANIC REACH**
 You create innovative, wow-worthy ideas to activate our athletes and events, and know exactly how to turn them into organic viral moments that people actually care about. And no — we don’t do paid ads.
   

  

**COMMUNITY MANAGEMENT**
 You proactively strengthen Red Bull’s presence through community management — driving engagement, answering questions, and keeping conversations alive with both consumers and social opinion leaders to build deeper interest in the brand.
   

  

**ANALYSIS & TREND MONITORING**
 To continuously optimize Red Bull Sweden’s communication, you identify, analyze, and adapt content in line with the latest digital trends. You stay ahead by tracking emerging technologies and spotting new opportunities to leverage them. Through insights from audience data, market research, and analytics tools, you actively shape and evolve our content strategy.
   

  

**Your areas of knowledge and expertise that matter most for this role:**
* Excellent film production and video editing skills. Experience with DaVinci Resolve is a strong plus.
* 2–3 years of experience in a similar role, building brands in social — both from a project management and creative perspective.
* A strong understanding of how content travels across social platforms, and how to maximize reach, relevance, and engagement.
* Fluent in spoken and written Swedish and English, with strong communication and collaboration skills.
* A genuine personal interest in areas such as extreme sports, gaming, motorsport, or music.


 Red Bull Sweden AB is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We welcome applications from all members of society irrespective of age, sex, disability, sexual orientation, race, religion.

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Data Engineer - Permanent, On-Site/Hybrid options**




 We are looking to support a forward-thinking organisation in Stockholm that are scaling their data capability and investing heavily in analytics, automation, and modern data infrastructure. You’ll join a small but growing cross-functional Data & Analytics team and take ownership of designing, building, and optimising data pipelines and data platforms.
 



  





**Responsibilities:**



* Designing, developing, and maintaining data pipelines (batch + streaming).
* Building data models and integrating diverse data sources into the data platform/warehouse.
* Contributing to architecture decisions and tooling improvements.
* Ensuring data quality, security, and governance practices.
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams to translate business requirements into data solutions.



  





**Experience profile:**



* Cloud platform: Azure / AWS (primarily working with Azure)
* Strong SQL + Python experience
* Experience with ETL/ELT pipeline development
* Experience with versioning and CI/CD for Data Engineering



  





**What to expect:**



* Competitive salary package & bonus
* Hybrid working model - average in the current team is 2–3 days per week in Stockholm
* Investment in personal development and certifications
* Opportunity to shape data architecture and influence technology choices



  





**Interested?**




 Apply via LinkedIn - while you can also apply and find more information about Formulate IT via our website: https://formulateit.eu/
 



  





 Even if this role isn’t a perfect match, we welcome applications from senior BI/analytics, and other IT professionals across Europe - we often work on positions that aren’t publicly listed.

title: Electronic Engineer
description:
Cleeven is an Engineering, R&D and IT consulting group enabling our clients support in their R&D efforts and operational excellence. We have know-hows in terms of innovation and R&D in a wide range of sectors: energy, services & banking, aerospace & defence, transportation, pharmaceuticals & chemicals, as well as IT & Telecoms.
 



  





 We are looking for talented electronics engineers to join our team. As an electronics engineer, you will be instrumental in the design, development, and implementation of cutting-edge electronic systems. Your role will involve collaborating with multidisciplinary teams to deliver high-quality solutions across a range of projects.
 



  





*Your responsibilities* 




  




* Designing and developing electronic systems and components
* Conducting feasibility studies and prototyping
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams on system integration
* Testing and troubleshooting electronic circuits and systems
* Contributing to innovation and research in electronics engineering



  





*Qualifications* 




  




* Degree in Electronics/Electrical Engineering or similar
* Experience in electronics design, simulation, and testing methodologies
* Familiarity with power or analog electronic and PCB design tools such as ALTIUM or CADENCE.
* Familiarity with digital electronics and hardware description languages such as VHDL or Verilog
* Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
* Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment



  





 Previous experience from - and understanding of embedded systems, electric power technologies as well as testing and verification of software or hardware systems is meritorious.

title: Managementkonsult inom IT
description:
Change of Lane är ett kompetent och engagerat konsultföretag med ett ambitiöst mål att vara det naturliga valet för både kunder och drivna Managementkonsulter.
 



 Vi är ett sammansvetsat team med djup kunskap inom ledarskap och förändringsarbete inom IT och i gränslandet till verksamheten. Tillsammans formar vi Change of Lane, driver vår utveckling framåt och skapar en kultur där kunskapsdelning, öppenhet, samarbete och gemenskap är centralt.
 



  





 Nu söker vi fler kollegor som vill vara en del av vårt härliga team!
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som Managementkonsult hos oss blir du en del av ett kompetensfyllt team som tillsammans driver och utvecklar Change of Lane. Du arbetar i lärorika uppdrag hos våra kunder inom både offentlig och privat sektor, där du stödjer kunderna med deras initiativ inom IT och i gränslandet till verksamheten. Uppdragen kan innebära allt från strategiska till operativa roller, såsom rådgivare, interimschef, projekt/programledare, verksamhetsutvecklare, förvaltningsledare och roller inom IT-/informationssäkerhet.
 



  





**Vi söker dig!** 




 Vi tror att du trivs i en öppen företagskultur där du förväntas vara med och påverka såväl din egen utveckling som bolagets tillväxtresa. Du är initiativtagande, nyfiken och trygg i din roll och du använder och har ett samarbetsorienterat arbetssätt. Utmaningar ser du som möjligheter och du drivs av att möta kundens förväntningar.
 



  





 Vi söker dig som har:
 


* Minst 3 års erfarenhet som konsult
* God förståelse för både operativ och strategisk IT, samt hur en IT-organisation samverkar med verksamheten
* Erfarenhet av att utveckla/skapa affärer genom att förlänga dina egna konsultuppdrag eller konsultförsäljning
* Relevant eftergymnasial utbildning från högskola eller universitet
* Erfarenhet som ledare, t.ex. projektledare, förändringsledare, eller liknande.



  





 Meriterande:
 


* Erfarenhet av offentlig sektor
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i verksamheter som jobbar agilt
* Certifieringar inom ramverk såsom SAFe, ADKAR, ITIL, ISO27000
* Erfarenhet av att använda AI som stöd i arbetet, eller drivit initiativ inom AI-lösningar



  





  





**Din framtid hos Change of Lane** 




 Hos oss får du möjlighet att växa och vidareutveckla dina kunskaper och erfarenheter. Vi tror på kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling och ser varje konsult som en viktig del av vår gemensamma framgång. Vi värdesätter engagemang, och här får du möjlighet att påverka, bidra med dina idéer och forma Change of Lane tillsammans med oss.
 



 Urval sker löpande, så tveka inte på att skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Har du frågor eller funderingar är du välkommen att kontakta oss via telefon 073 7089 939.
 



  





 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: Data Platform and AI Sales Executive
description:
Join us to work with the largest customers in their industries. You will get the opportunity to build creative solutions to address the business challenges that stand in the way of their growth and success!
 



 Oracle is a fast-paced, collaborative environment passionate about crafting customer success. We offer the most comprehensive, cloud-based technology. At Oracle, learning is constant. We develop our workforce through training, mentoring and internal mobility opportunities to help everyone succeed and achieve their aspirations.
 



 Be an integral part of the exciting transformation to the cloud by identifying, progressing, and closing opportunities in marque customers.
 



**What you will do** 



* Champion Oracle’s premier Data Platform, a unified solution that integrates our world-class database technology with AI, analytics, and autonomous capabilities across all infrastructures.
* You will understand what motivates customers to buy and what drives the industry to grow faster and know how to tap into those needs in an effective way.
* You will be responsible for encouraging long-term strategic relationships within select high profile enterprise accounts.
* You will develop a robust qualified pipeline and handle strategic and customer centric account planning, crafting, owning and forecasting.
* You will be the trusted advisor and influencer in winning customer decisions to buy, architect and adopt Oracle solutions.
* You will work across the Oracle ecosystems and our technology partners to transform customer organizations and build enduring capabilities.
* Cultivate client relationships by building trust, partnership and an emotional connection to the Oracle brand and team.
* Gain access and establish relationships with key executives, C-level leaders and decision makers.
* Master and share the "why Oracle story" that represents the value we provide to customers with our unified, multi-pillar offerings.
* Build and implement key sales and business development initiatives to improve awareness of Oracle Data and PaaS Solutions and increase sales pipeline.
* Successfully prospect into your assigned accounts to discover and develop viable selling opportunities.
* Initiate and lead sophisticated sales cycles, using the support and strengths of key internal partners (Pre-Sales, Product Management, Executives and Industry Global Business Units to name a few).
* Travel as required, as this role may be a virtual position.



  





  





**What you will bring** 




 Your passion, knowledge, and customer-centricity will help us become the number one cloud company in the world. We also look for:
 


* You have experience engaging with C-suite, and IT.
* You thrive in dynamic environments and embrace an entrepreneurial mindset.
* You bring creativity and innovative thinking to problem-solving.
* You excel in collaborative, team-oriented settings.
* You are motivated by challenges and driven to make an impact.
* You have experience with IaaS, PaaS, and database solutions.
* You are familiar with open-source technologies and competitive databases to Oracle database such as Postgres and MongoDB
* You are solutions oriented and proactive in overcoming challenges.
* You have a track record of success in consultative selling and exceeding goals.
* You are committed to continuous learning.
* You communicate with confidence and authenticity.
* Language skills: English and Swedish.



  





**What we will offer you** 



* A competitive salary with exciting benefits
* Flexible and remote working so you can do your best work
* Learning and development opportunities to advance your career
* An Employee Assistance Program to support your mental health
* Employee resource groups that champion our diverse communities
* Core benefits such as medical, life insurance, and access to retirement planning
* An inclusive culture that celebrates what makes you unique.



  





 At Oracle, we don’t just respect differences—we celebrate them. We believe that innovation starts with inclusion and to create the future we need people with diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and abilities. That’s why we’re committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people can do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued that we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before.
 



 https://www.oracle.com/corporate/careers/diversity-inclusion/

title: Business Analyst
description:
If you love working with data to solve business problems, enjoy learning and uncovering new insights, and want to be part of a collaborative and passionate team, this is the role for you!
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 You will join the Revenue Operations team at Funnel as our lead Business Analyst, working closely with commercial leadership. This role is all about curiosity, impact, and using data to answer the questions that truly matter to the business.
   

  

 You will partner closely with the VP of Revenue Operations on forecasting, revenue target setting, and performance tracking. You will also collaborate with Finance and act as the primary customer of Funnel’s Internal Data and AI team, ensuring our data stack supports the questions the business wants answered.
   

  

 This is a high-impact role where your work will regularly be part of leadership discussions, forecasting cycles, and monthly business reviews. You won’t just crunch numbers—you’ll be involved in the full journey from question to insight to recommendation to change, and see your work influence real decisions. 🚀
   

  

**Your Responsibilities Will Include, But Are Not Limited To**
* Support forecasting processes and revenue planning in close partnership with RevOps and Finance.
* Analyze sales performance, pipeline generation, and commercial trends to uncover insights and opportunities.
* Turn complex data into clear, compelling stories that leaders can act on.
* Work hands-on with our data stack, using SQL daily and collaborating closely with the data team to shape models and tables.
* Act as a bridge between technical data capabilities and everyday business needs.
* Partner with RevOps to spot gaps in processes, enablement, and reporting, and help define practical solutions.


**Some Examples Of Past And Current Deliverables**
* Deep dives into sales performance trends to explain what is driving results and where to focus next.
* Pipeline generation analysis that directly informs weekly and monthly forecasting decisions.
* Insights that feed into enablement initiatives and process improvements across go-to-market teams.


**Who You Are**
 You enjoy thinking about the business as much as working with data. You care about quality, accuracy, and understanding the story behind the numbers.
   

  

 You are curious, thoughtful, and enjoy taking ownership of problems from start to finish. You love learning new things and are excited to work closely with senior leaders to help them make better decisions through data.
   

  

**We Are Looking For Someone Who Is**
* Naturally curious with a lifelong learning mindset.
* Conscientious and collaborative, quality-driven, with pride in their work.
* Comfortable balancing business thinking with an analytical approach.
* Confident in presenting insights to senior stakeholders, including leadership and board-level audiences.
* A clear and open communicator who can distill complicated data into meaningful insights.


**Experiences & Skills**
* Strong SQL skills and confidence working directly with data tables daily.
* Experience using BI tools such as Looker, Tableau, or Power BI, knowing when to go beyond dashboards for deeper analysis.
* Proficiency in Python or R, or strong motivation to grow these skills to support advanced analysis.
* Experience working with commercial, revenue, or internal business data.
* Fluent in written and spoken English.


**It Is Beneficial If You Also Have**
* Experience working with SaaS, CRM, sales pipeline, or go-to-market data.
* Exposure to forecasting, revenue planning, or performance management.
* Experience leveraging AI and data automation.


**Location & Eligibility**
 At this time, we can only consider applicants who meet one of the following criteria:
   

  

* Hold Swedish citizenship
* Hold EU/EEA citizenship
* Have a valid Swedish work permit


**Office-first**
 At Funnel, we have an office-first approach, and we work from the office a minimum of four days a week. We have lots of flexibility for when life happens, during the summer, and through the holidays. We just like to avoid having standing remote days.
   

  

**About Funnel**
 Funnel is the leading Marketing Intelligence platform that empowers marketers to automatically collect, model, visualize, and analyze data from over 500 marketing platforms—without the need for SQL or scripting.
   

  

 Now equipped with measurement, Funnel combines Marketing Mix Modelling, Multi-Touch Attribution, and Incrementality Testing to triangulate the true effectiveness of marketing efforts and provide smart, data-driven suggestions.
   

  

 Funnel enables a workflow that automates the collection of all the data the customer needs, easy creation and maintenance of a robust data model with the customer's own concepts and metrics, with an AI-powered model for marketing measurement, and beautiful reporting on top.
   

  

 All this without the user having to write a single line of code or even be particularly technical. Our vision is that the people who need data for their decision-making should have the tools to do it themselves - and not be dependent on their technical colleagues.
   

  

 Trusted by more than 2,000 businesses worldwide, including globally recognized brands such as Adidas and Sony, Funnel generated over $50M in ARR in 2023 and continues to feature in the FT 1000 list of Europe’s fastest-growing companies.
   

  

 Since its founding in 2014, Funnel has grown into a global team of over 300 employees, with offices in Stockholm, Boston, Hamburg, and Sydney.
   

  

 Funnel is a SaaS product designed to help marketing teams own their performance. Founded in 2014 in Stockholm, and still founder-led, the Funnel team has grown with our customers – serving more than 2,000 companies from our Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, Hamburg and Sydney offices. We value increased in-person collaboration, and as such, we work a minimum of four days a week from our offices.
   

  

 We have always put the customer first, expressed in a no-commission sales model and a customer-centric development approach. We are proud to help companies such as Havas Media, Adidas, Sony, and Home Depot to unlock the true impact of their data.

title: Data Engineer
description:

 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.

title: IT-drifttekniker 24/7
description:
Är du vår nästa IT-drifttekniker? Vill du vara med på resan mot ett än mer elektrifierat Sverige? Då kan det här vara tjänsten för dig.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 I rollen som IT-drifttekniker kommer du främst att ansvara för 1:a linjens incidenthantering, initial felsökning, fördelning av ärenden samt monitorering av flöden och larm. Du får en central position där du säkerställer och samordnar det som krävs för att garantera en hög driftsäkerhet. Tillsammans med kollegorna arbetar ni tätt tillsammans och agerar snabbt för att incidenter ska få en så liten negativ påverkan som möjligt.
   

  

 Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

* Ta emot incidenter och skapa ärenden i ärendehanteringssystemet
* Åtgärda och/eller skicka vidare öppna incidenter till 2:a/3:e linjen
* Utföra enklare diagnostiseringar och återställa tjänster enligt instruktioner (Linux, Nätverk och Windows)
* Följa upp och återkoppla ärenden till såväl tekniker som anmälare.
* Arbeta enligt ITIL med fokus på incidenter i ärendehanteringssystemet samt förbättringsarbeten


 I rollen som IT-drifttekniker kommer du att bidra till att säkerställa en stabil IT-Driftmiljö för Svenska kraftnät. Här får du utmanas i att agera tillräckligt fort och hitta avvikelser innan det påverkar användarna.
   

  

 Tjänsten innebär rullande 2-skift det vill säga arbete både dag och natt. Alla pass är 12 timmar, antingen från kl 07.00 – 19.00 eller från kl 19.00 – 07.00. Arbetet sker på plats.
   

  

 Utvecklingsmöjligheterna är goda då IT-divisionen på Svenska kraftnät är under kraftig tillväxt och det finns möjlighet att byta erfarenheter med kollegor som verkat länge inom branschen.
   

  

 Som IT-drifttekniker tillhör du enheten IT-Driftcentral som består av 10 medarbetare som alla har samma roll. Du kommer att ha många kontaktytor, framförallt internt, men även externt i form av leverantörskontakter med mera.
   

  

**Om dig**
 För att bli framgångsrik i den här rollen ser vi att du är en ansvarstagande person som ser ditt arbete som viktigt och vill samarbeta i teamet. Du är strukturerad i hur du tar dig an uppgifter samt möter deadlines. Som person har du god känsla för service och förmåga att både lyssna in, förstå och kommunicera väl för att prioritera rätt saker. Vi söker dig som har god förmåga att snabbt sätta dig in i nya verktyg och processer samt vill bidra till förbättringsarbete.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Vidare ser vi att du har examen inom IT, systemvetenskap eller motsvarande utbildning eller arbetslivserfarenhet som vi bedömer likvärdig. Du har även:
   

  

* Minst 2 års aktuell och relevant erfarenhet av arbete i 1:a eller 2:a linjens support av Windows och/eller Linux miljöer
* Erfarenhet inom serverdrift (t ex Linux/Unix, Windows)
* God förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska


 Vi ser det som
 **meriterande** 
 om du har:
   

  

* Arbetat enligt ITIL-processerna (Incident, Problem, Change, Request)
* Erfarenhet av monitorering och larmhantering exempelvis från arbete i en NOC/systemövervakningsfunktion
* Erfarenhet av arbete i kritiska miljöer (t ex energisektorn, telekom, finans) där driftsäkerhet är avgörande


**Bra att veta**
* Tjänsten är placerad i Sundbyberg (precis vid stationen), Stockholm
* Arbetet sker på plats
* Sista ansökningsdag är 2026-01-26, vi använder urvalsfrågor istället för personligt brev
* Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid med rullande skiftschema 24/7
* I denna rekryteringsprocess tillämpas screeningtest
* Förmåner | Svenska kraftnät


 Kontakta gärna rekryterande chef Magnus Hallqvist, tel. nr. 010-475 82 53 alternativt ansvarig rekryterare Maria Sahlén, tel. nr. 010-489 20 27 (maria.sahlen2@svk.se). Fackliga representanter är Annika Ingeborn, SACO, 010-475 87 72 och Erica Midfjäll, ST, 010-475 87 31. Du når oss också via e-post: fornamn.efternamn@svk.se
   

  

 Övrig information
   

  

 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Innan ett beslut om anställning fattas kommer en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) att genomföras i de fall befattningen innebär hantering av säkerhetsskyddsklassificerade uppgifter eller deltagande i säkerhetskänslig verksamhet. Om anställningen avser befattning i säkerhetsklass kommer säkerhetsprövningen även att innefatta en registerkontroll och, i vissa fall, en särskild personutredning. För anställning på Svenska kraftnät kan det vara ett krav på svenskt medborgarskap i vissa befattningar. Med anställningen följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. För mer information om säkerhetsprövning Svenska kraftnät arbetar för att främja mångfald och motverka diskriminering och ser gärna sökanden med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter till våra rekryteringar. Lär känna Svenska kraftnät och hur det är att arbeta hos oss: Lär känna oss på Svenska kraftnät

title: ServiceNow Technical Specialist
description:
**Role:** 
 ServiceNow Technical Specialist
 



**Experience (Years):** 
 8–12 years
 



**Language requirement:** 
 Swedish & English
 



  





**Tata consultancy Services** 
 is an IT services, consulting and business solutions organization that has been partnering with many of the world’s largest businesses for the past 50 years. We believe innovation and collective knowledge can transform all our futures with greater purpose. We help companies across industries achieve their strategic goals and lead their digital transformation programs. With 600,000 experts globally and 18,000+ consultants working for leading Nordic Customers, we have a strong sense of purpose for the ecosystem around us – our employees, partners, customers and society.
 



  





**Role Summary:** 




  





 The ServiceNow Technical Specialist will play a key role in delivering enterprise-grade ServiceNow implementations across ITSM, ITOM, ITAM, HRSD, and CSM domains for Nordic clients. The role combines technical leadership, solution design, and delivery governance to support large transformation initiatives across industries. The ideal candidate should have a strong understanding of ITIL processes, hands-on ServiceNow development experience, and proven ability to manage multi-disciplinary teams in global delivery environments.
 







**Key Responsibilities** 




  





**Portfolio Management** 




  




* Lead multiple ServiceNow transformation projects across diverse industries (Telecom, Manufacturing, BFSI, Energy).
* Oversee implementation roadmaps, milestones, and delivery KPIs.
* Manage client expectations, ensuring business outcomes are met within time, cost, and quality parameters.



  





**Solutions and Relationship Management** 




  




* Collaborate with business stakeholders to identify automation and digitization opportunities.
* Define solution architecture, integrations, and custom applications within the ServiceNow platform.
* Engage in pre-sales solutioning, RFP responses, and service transformation proposals.
* Build and maintain long-term relationships with Nordic client stakeholders.



  





**Delivery Governance** 




  




* Provide governance on ServiceNow best practices, design standards, and release management.
* Mentor developers and ensure adherence to coding, testing, and documentation standards.
* Conduct design reviews, security assessments, and platform health checks.
* Support transition to managed services ensuring stability and scalability of deployed solutions.







**Required Experience** 




  




* 8–12 years of IT experience in ServiceNow implementation and customization.
* Strong technical expertise in modules such as ITSM, ITOM, ITAM, CSM, or HRSD.
* Proficient in scripting (JavaScript, Glide API), Flow Designer, and ServiceNow Integration Hub.
* Experience with ServiceNow CMDB, Discovery, Event Management, and Service Mapping.
* Proven ability to design integrations with external systems (APIs, Web Services, MID Server).
* Exposure to Agile and DevOps practices for ServiceNow delivery.
* Prior experience working with Nordic or European clients preferred.







**Qualifications** 




  




* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
* ServiceNow Certified System Administrator (mandatory).
* One or more advanced certifications (ITSM Implementation Specialist, Discovery, Integration Hub, ITOM) preferred.
* ITIL v4 Foundation certification desirable.



  





**Does that sound interesting?** 




  





 You are welcome to submit your application consisting of your CV, personal letter, relevant degrees or certifications details, professional references, etc. We work with ongoing recruitment so send in your application as soon as possible.
 



  





 We look forward to receiving your application via LinkedIn or mail to
 **aswini.ranganathan@tcs.com**
