title: Senior Services Owner
description:
**Do you want to be at the forefront of protecting our society against cyber threats? We are looking for a Senior Service Owner to lead our flagship Managed Detection & Response (MDR) service, combining cutting-edge cloud technology with expert SOC operations to deliver best-in-class cybersecurity protection for our customers in our Managed Security Services domain.**
**About Truesec – A Leading Cybersecurity Company**
 Since 2005, Truesec has been a native cybersecurity company, driven by one single purpose: Creating safety and sustainability in a digital world by preventing cyber breach and minimizing impact.
   

  

 Over the years, we’ve earned the trust of organizations worldwide and gained a strong reputation internationally. Our team consists of dedicated specialists covering the entire spectrum of cybersecurity – with capabilities in Predict, Prevent, Protect, Respond, and Recover.
   

  

 Today, we employ around 350 employees – and as cybercrime grows, we need to grow. To support that goal, we are now looking for a Senior Services Owner who wants to make a difference in our Managed Security Services domain.
   

  

**Managed Security Services**
 Truesec helps customers globally with Managed Detection & Response including Attack Prediction Services, Vulnerability Management Services for both IT and OT environment. Our services are all delivered by skilled security analysis teams that conduct 24/7 attack monitoring, threat hunting, threat intelligence analysis, and threat remediation. Our team of experts works tirelessly to identify and prevent cyber breaches, and to help increase our customers’ proactive cybersecurity defenses. Our goal is to be an extension of our customers’ IT organizations, customizing a combination of capabilities and tooling, tailored to prevent cyber attacks in the most efficient way.
   

  

**The Role**
 You'll drive the evolution of our established MDR service, accelerating development to meet emerging customer needs and support our expansion, with particular focus on the Nordic markets. Working at the intersection of our cloud platform and SOC operations, you'll shape the future of how we detect and respond to cyber threats at scale while enabling our go-to-market teams to succeed across European markets.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Collaborate to develop and execute the MDR services strategy and roadmap, ensuring alignment with business objectives and evolving market demands.
* Engage with customers to deeply understand needs, pain points, and opportunities for service enhancement.
* Partner with engineering teams and SOC leadership to optimize workflows, service delivery, and platform development.
* Monitor the cybersecurity landscape, competitor offerings, and market trends to identify strategic opportunities.
* Work closely with sales and marketing teams to support growth efforts, including creating compelling content and developing go-to-market strategies.
* Define and track key metrics for service performance, operational efficiency, and customer success.
* Foster collaboration between technology and human-driven SOC operations to ensure operational excellence.


**Your Potential Background**
* 10+ years of IT-service management experience with a track record in B2B products or services (cybersecurity, SaaS, or service-oriented industries).
* Strong problem-solving and analytical skills along with technical skills.
* Experience within MDR, SOC operations, and cybersecurity.
* Experience supporting go-to-market teams, familiarity with European and Nordic markets is a plus.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to translate complex concepts for diverse audiences.
* Fluency in English; Nordic languages are an advantage but not mandatory.


**Impact**
 You'll play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our most strategic service, directly influencing how we protect organizations across Europe from cyber threats. Your work will drive both customer success and company growth as we expand our presence in the Nordic region and strengthen our position as a leader in the European market.
   

  

***Due to the sensitivity in our assignments, we require Swedish citizenship, citizenship in an EU country, or a Swedish work permit.***
***Due to Christmas holidays, selection and interviews will begin in January 2026.***
**Join Our Mission Toward a Safe Digital Future**
 If you truly want to make a difference and make our world a little bit safer, this is the place for you. At Truesec, you'll get to be at the forefront of fighting cybercrime instead of reading about it in the news. This is your chance to be part of an exciting journey in a leading cybersecurity company - and learn from some of the best in their field.
   

  

 So, are you ready to team up with the most dedicated team of experts and be part of a meaningful mission? Then we are excited to get to know you!

title: Finance Lead
description:
***Where accounting meets how the business actually works***




  




**About the role** 

  






 We are looking for a Finance Lead who understands accounting deeply and enjoys connecting numbers to real business decisions.
 




  






 This role is about ensuring that accounting, management reporting, and business insight are built on the same financial truth. We operate across multiple entities and markets, with outsourced accounting and a highly automated setup. Ownership of the numbers sits with you.
 




  






 You will take full responsibility for financial accuracy and insight, working closely with the COO and leadership team. Our ambition is simple and demanding: at any point in time, we should be able to close the month, trust the result, and use it to steer the business.
 




  




**What you will do** 

  





**Own the financial truth** 



* Own P&L, balance sheet, and cash flow across multiple entities
* Lead month-end close, reconciliations, and documentation
* Be the main counterpart to external accountants



  





**Connect accounting to the business** 



* Ensure revenue, costs, inventory, and logistics flows reflect how the business actually operates
* Translate operational complexity into clean accounting logic
* Act as a bridge between finance, operations, and commercial teams



  





**Multi-entity, tax, and structure** 



* Maintain a clear view of intercompany flows and entity performance
* Ensure transfer pricing principles are applied and reflected in reporting
* Coordinate with external advisors on VAT and tax matters



  





**Make finance decision-driving** 



* Anchor management reporting and BI in accounting numbers
* Support leadership with analysis grounded in the ledger
* Eliminate parallel versions of the truth



  





**Accruals, automation, and control** 



* Build robust accruals and cut-off logic
* Monitor, test, and validate automated postings and integrations
* Strengthen controls and documentation as the business scales



  





**AP, AR, and cash** 



* Own accounts payable and receivable processes
* Validate supplier invoices, especially logistics and carriers
* Maintain visibility on cash flow and working capital



  




**Who you are**
* Strong accounting foundation from audit, financial DD, transaction services, or controlling
* Comfortable in multi-entity, cross-border environments
* Curious about systems and automation, sceptical until numbers reconcile
* Business-minded, structured, and precise



  






 You care about getting the numbers right, and you care just as much that they are trusted and used.
 




  




**What we offer** 

  




* Full ownership of finance in a growing international company
* Close collaboration with the CFO/COO and leadership team
* Real complexity and responsibility, not just reporting
* An ambitious culture that values doing things properly

title: Product Owner
description:
We’re looking for a Product Owner to join us at Telia.
   

  

 I’m
 **Jussi Jääskeläinen, Head of Product & Solution Integration** 
 , and I’m searching for someone ready to grow with us. We’re a team focused on evolving Service Hub, which is our in-house product integration and feature add-on platform. You will act as the Product Owner for one of the Service Hub application teams (Thor). It’s a big team with two development tracks.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
 You will have a key role in planning the Program Increments and sprint iterations and work with several Product Managers on feature definition and priorities.
   

  

 Even though the Product Owner role takes most of your time, this position includes hands-on development work as well. The role combines product thinking, technical decision-making, and hands-on execution, aligned with Scrum and SAFe ways of working. You will:
   

  

* Own and evolve the product vision, roadmap, and backlog.
* Translate business and strategic objectives into clear, implementable technical requirements.
* Actively contribute as a developer (design, coding, reviews, troubleshooting).
* Collaborate daily with developers and DevOps engineers in a shared responsibility model.
* Ensure high quality through DevSecOps practices, automation, and observability.
* Work in distributed, cross-border teams, including close cooperation with our Swedish partner.
* Drive continuous improvement in architecture, reliability, and developer experience.


**What will help you thrive in this role:**
 You are a senior Product Owner with a developer mindset, or a senior developer who has taken strong product ownership responsibilities. You combine technical credibility with clear product thinking.
   

  

 If you are motivated by building impactful products in close collaboration with engineers, this role could be an excellent fit. You also have:
   

  

* Understanding of cloud-native architectures, DevOps, and SRE principles.
* Ability to balance short-term delivery with long-term product sustainability.
* Excellent collaboration and communication skills across technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* A mindset that promotes psychological safety, openness, and continuous learning.


 This role focuses on leading through contribution, clarity, and example.
   

  

**Our technical stack and engineering environment:**
 Our Service Hub platform is Java-centric, cloud-native, and built for scalability, reliability, and integration-heavy workloads.
   

  

* Core technologies (majority of development): Java (:80%), Spring Boot, Quarkus, WildFly, Vert.x.
* Additional backend & scripting languages: Kotlin, Python (primarily for scripting and automation), Bash, SQL.
* Frontend technologies: TypeScript, Angular.
* Cloud & platform technologies: Kubernetes, Helm, public and sovereign cloud platforms (AWS, UpCloud, Welkin).
* Engineering practices and tooling: GitHub & Jira, DevSecOps, IaC, CI/CD pipelines, observability and monitoring, uutomated testing, including security and penetration testing.


 As a technical product owner, you are expected to be comfortable working directly in this stack, even if you do not specialize in every technology.
   

  

**Join us to shape smarter living for people, businesses, and the planet**
 At Telia, we’re a team of 15 000 colleagues across the Nordics and Baltics, passionate about technology and connectivity. As a
 **Leading Telecommunications Operator** 
 &
 **Climate Leader** 
 , we drive change with large-scale, impactful projects while building a sustainable, inclusive world.
   

  

 Here, you can
 **grow your skills, lead meaningful projects, and thrive in a supportive, diverse environment.** 
 Whether you’re taking your first step or your next, Telia is a place to grow, belong, and make a real impact.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 When you join us, you'll receive a comprehensive benefits package tailored to your local market, opportunities for remote work, and more. You'll also have the chance to earn a bonus based on your performance and Telia's results.
   

  

**Ready to make better happen?**
 We look forward to receiving your application by
 **25th of January** 
 . Please note that we might close the position earlier if we find the right candidate, so don’t wait too long to apply!
   

  

 If you’re selected for the next stage, you’ll be contacted by either the
 **Hiring Manager or our Talent Acquisition Partner** 
 . Background and reference checks will be part of the process.
   

  

 Want to know more about this role? Please reach out to
 **Jussi Jääskeläinen** 
 at jussi.jaaskelainen@teliacompany.com or LinkedIn and read my LinkedIn post about it.
   

  

**Equal opportunities**
 At Telia, we recognize talent by
 **professional skills and growth potential.** 
 We champion diversity, ensuring every individual’s needs are met, regardless of disability, gender, age, nationality, sexual orientation, or social status. Together, we’re dedicated to fostering an inclusive work environment where
 **your uniqueness is our strength.**
**Join us and let’s make better happen - together**

title: Integration- och testkoordinator
description:
**Professional Galaxy** 
 är ett IT och teknikkonsultbolag som tillhandahåller högspecialiserad kompetens inom IT, utveckling, elektronik och mekanik konstruktion. Vi arbetar med seniora experter och levererar strategiskt värdeskapande kompetens till några av Sveriges mest komplexa och samhällskritiska projekt. Vårt fokus ligger alltid på hög kvalitet, professionalism och mätbara resultat.
   

  

 Är du rätt person för uppdraget, eller vill du rekommendera en stark kandidat? Tveka inte att kontakta oss.
   

  

 Ansök gärna redan idag – urval och intervjuer sker löpande.
   

  

 Professional Galaxy söker en
 **Integration- och testkoordinator** 
 på uppdrag av vår klient.
   

  

 Klient inför teknik för varning till allmänheten. Tekniken cell broadcast ska införs genom systemet SE-Alert. SE Alert är ett varningssystem, en kanal, där myndigheter i Sverige skickar ut VMAmeddelanden. Genom SE Alert förmedlas VMA (Viktigt meddelande till allmänheten) direkt till mobiltelefoner som finns i ett område där det uppstått en fara för allmänheten. SE Alert har ett igenkännligt ljud som tydligt skiljer sig från exempelvis sms eller pushnotiser.
   

  

 Arbetet genomförs tillsammans med Post och telestyrelsen och SOS Alarm AB. Andra aktörer i införandet är mobiloperatörerna med eget nät (Telia, Tele2, Telenor, Tre) samt Google och Apple som i sina operativsystem tillhandahåller funktionalitet för cell broadcasttekniken.
   

  

 Målsättningen är att systemet ska vara i drift i juni 2026. Innan systemet kan driftsättas måste integration och tester (E2E) genomföras. Konsult ska koordinera arbete med integration och tester samt upprätta dokumentation för dessa.
   

  

 Tjänsten innefattar koordinering och planering av integration och tester av systemet samt upprättande av dokumentation av genomförda tester. Arbetet ska ske i samarbete med MSB, PTS, SOS Alarm AB, mobilnätsoperatörerna (och deras underleverantörer). Visst arbete kommer genomföras med Apple och Google.
   

  

**Ska-krav:**
* Kompetensnivå 3 (4-8 år).
* Konsulten ska ha erfarenhet av integrationstester och End-to-End tester.
* Konsulten ska ha erfarenhet från större projekt och är van att koordinera tester med flera olika aktörer, följa upp och dokumentera resultat.


**Bör-krav:**
* Konsulten bör ha erfarenhet från arbete inom it- och telekomsektorn.
* Konsulten bör ha erfarenhet av arbete med Google och Apple.


**Referenser** 
 :
   

  

 Referenser Leverantören ska lämna två (2) referenser från uppdrag som är relevanta för den aktuella upphandlingen. Referenserna ska avse uppdrag som genomförts under de senaste fem (5) åren.
   

  

 Varje referens ska innehålla följande uppgifter:
   

  

* Kundens namn och organisation
* Kontaktperson med telefonnummer och e‑postadress
* Tidpunkt för genomförandet (start- och slutdatum)
* Kort beskrivning av uppdragets omfattning, innehåll och resultat


 Information gällande nedan kriterium som kommer att utvärderas:
   

  

* Relevans till uppdraget
* Omfattning och komplexitet
* Konsultens roll och ansvar


**Omfattning** 
 :
   

  

 100%
   

  

**Stationeringsort** 
 :
   

  

 Uppdraget kan utföras på distans hos leverantören men konsulten kan behöva vara på plats vid enstaka tillfällen.
   

  

**Start-slut + option:**
 2026-02-09 - 2026-06-30 + option: 2+2 mån.
   

  

**Övrig information**
 Möjlighet till förlängning: Ja
   

  

 Uppdragsperiod: 2026-02-09 – 2026-06-30
   

  

 Sista ansökningsdag:
 **2026-01-14**
 Ansök genom att bifoga ditt CV (vi vill inte ha något personligt brev) och besvara urvalsfrågorna. Frågorna utgår från kravprofilen för den här rekryteringen och dina svar ligger till grund för det urval som sker i processen. Att besvara frågorna är en förutsättning för att din ansökan ska anses komplett.
   

  

 Vänligen notera att krav och eventuella meriter ska vara uppfyllda vid ansökningstillfället.

title: Senior Full Stack Developer
description:
**About Kisi**
 We are Kisi, a physical security tech company revolutionizing how businesses access and secure their spaces.
   

  

 Founded in 2012, with headquarters in Brooklyn, an office in Stockholm, and a global team, we create innovative, award-winning hardware and compliance-certified software that enable seamless, cloud-based access to offices, facilities, and buildings. Our mission is to ensure ease of access and remote space management, fostering a future where spaces are securely connected and accessible without boundaries.
   

  

 At Kisi, you’ll join a creative and innovative team with a flat hierarchy, work closely with our co-founders, and enjoy the freedom to work your way with a strong sense of ownership.
   

  

 If you’re passionate about cutting-edge technology and want to be part of a dynamic team that’s making the world more secure and accessible, we want to hear from you!
   

  

 Your role
   

  

 We are seeking a highly motivated Senior Full Stack Developer to join our dynamic team and help expand our innovative product portfolio. Our mission is to seamlessly connect people and spaces through an open platform that includes cloud-based video intercoms, wireless locks, and third-party access control systems. The ideal candidate will possess a robust background in full-stack web development, proficiency in modern frameworks and best practices, and a passion for creating cutting-edge user experiences. In this role, you will design, develop, and optimize sophisticated web applications, mentor junior developers, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the highest standards of performance, reliability, and security.
   

  

 Your responsibilities
   

  

* Coordinate with product and engineering managers to align development with business goals.
* Architect, design, and implement efficient, scalable, and responsive web applications using modern frameworks and technologies across teams (e.g. design, platform).
* Monitor relevant metrics and identify areas for improvement, e.g. according to web performance best practices.
* Address bugs and performance issues through automated unit, integration, and end-to-end testing.
* Address vulnerabilities, apply updates, and maintain security documentation proactively.
* Mentor junior developers, interns, conduct code reviews, and offer guidance on complex tasks.


**Your Qualifications**
* 3+ years of progressive experience in web development, including front-end and back-end integration.
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (preferred).
* Expertise in web technologies (HTML, CSS) and languages, frameworks and libraries (e.g. TypeScript, React, React Query, Tailwind).
* Strong full-stack capabilities, including server-side development and API integration.
* Proficiency in Node.js and it's http frameworks like express/fastify/tRPC.
* Experience with relational database systems (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL)
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, or GCP) and containerization technologies (e.g., Docker ).
* Proficiency in version control systems (Git) and agile collaboration (e.g., GitHub, Jira, or similar).
* Proven track record of performance optimization, including load time improvements and resource management.
* Experience with automated testing frameworks (Cypress/Playwright) and debugging complex issues across the full stack.
* Outstanding communication skills, with the ability to articulate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Excellent organizational and project management abilities, ensuring efficient task prioritization and timely delivery.
* Commitment to continuous learning and staying current with emerging web development trends and best practices.


 Your process with us
   

  

* Application: Submit your application through our online form and include a link to your LinkedIn profile.
* CV Screening: Our recruiting team will review your resume to assess your background, skills, and fit for the role.
* Technical test task: You’ll receive a short, take-home technical assignment designed to simulate the kinds of problems you’ll tackle on the job.
* Technical interview: Meet one-on-one (via video call) with a member of our support team to walk through your test task, discuss your approach, and dive deeper into your technical experience.
* Culture interview: Have a conversation with cross-functional team members to learn more about our values, work style, and company culture—and for us to learn more about what motivates you.
* Offer: If it’s a mutual fit, we’ll extend a formal offer and welcome you to the Kisi team.


 After successful interviews and the job offer is signed, we will conduct a background check.

title: Resident Protocol and Events Officer – Permanent EIB Representation Brussels & Brussels/Belgium
description:
The
 **EIB** 
 , the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Secretariat General Directorate (SG) – Shareholder Relations and Institutional Matters Department (SR&IM) – Protocol, Visits and Events Division (PTL) located in Brussels/Belgium, a
 **Resident Protocol and Events Officer – Permanent EIB Representation Brussels\*.**
**This is a full time position at grade 5 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract in Brussels /Belgium.**
* internal benchmark Facilities Management Officer


*Panel interviews are anticipated for the first half of February 2026.*
 Purpose
   

  

 You will coordinate and organise visits and events mainly in Brussels and occasionally in Headquarters. You will deliver Protocol services for the President and MC members, liaise with EU Institutions and other organisations and their protocol services in order to ensure smooth execution of high-level engagements. You will represent the Head of Division at key events and meetings in order to maintain continuity and uphold organisational presence. You will regularly prepare and accompany the President on business travels in order to guarantee effective protocol and logistical support.
   

  

 Operating Network
   

  

 You will report to the Head of Protocol, Visits and Events Division.
   

  

 The Protocol, Visits and Events Division is responsible for the overall planning, management and supervision of the full range of protocol, meeting, dining and events services in and outside the EU. It maintains protocol relations with representatives of Member States, EU Institutions and other national, international and multilateral institutions and organisations.
   

  

 Protocol activities include official visits to the Bank, official visits of EIB President abroad, the visitor group service, all staff events and any kind of high profile outreach event in Luxembourg, in and outside the EU, whether EIB organised or event sponsorships.
   

  

 The position requires availability outside standard working hours and regular business travel (sometimes on short notice).
   

  

 Accountabilities
   

  

* Provide professional protocol support for the EIB President, Management Committee (MC) members and other senior managers or staff when visiting Brussels, the EIB Office, any EU Institution or Body or any other national or international organisation or institution, exercising diplomacy and exhibiting excellent understanding of the EIB mission, and the EU institutional and political framework.
* Prepare missions for the President and accompany the President and delegations on missions outside Belgium and Luxembourg, as assigned by the Head of Division.
* Manage Official and corporate meetings and events organised by the division in Brussels, whether in the EIB Brussels Office or in an external venue – in close collaboration with Head of Division and/or senior colleagues based at the EIB head offices in Luxembourg, ensuring the satisfaction of MC and other internal and external key stakeholders.
* Represent the EIB Group and the Head of Division when delegated, actively promoting the interests and requirements of the Bank and the division.
* Ensure protocol access and a professional welcome when visiting other institutions by liaising with relevant counterparts and accompanying senior management where appropriate.
* Organise official and corporate meetings and events in Brussels, both at the EIB Brussels Office and external venues, in close collaboration with the Head of Division and senior colleagues in Luxembourg.
* Guarantee high-quality organisation and stakeholder satisfaction for bilateral meetings, signature ceremonies, seminars, and receptions.
* Coordinate with Brussels Office colleagues in charge of meeting room management and catering, ensuring smooth execution of event.
* Manage protocol arrangements for visits to the EIB Permanent Representation in Brussels, liaising with the Head of Representation and the Head of Division.
* Oversee protocol tasks for official visits, including seating plans, protocol gifts, and coordination with building security or police.
* Managing activities related to event sponsorships in Brussels including budget, efficiently coordinated with the EIB Permanent Representative and the Brussels staff members tasked by the Head of Office.
* Analyse and evaluate requests for event sponsorships/partnerships and provide a recommendation to the Head of Division and Director to allow a sound and informed decision.
* Responsible for overseeing all administrative tasks related to the core tasks in Brussels including statistics and inventories as well as budget control.
* Coordinate with the Brussels Office colleagues responsible for meeting room management and catering to ensure the organisation of smooth and high quality bilateral meetings, signature ceremonies, seminars and receptions.
* Liaise and coordinate efficiently with the external service providers and their staff on site.
* Develop and maintain a strong network of contacts within EU institutions and other national or international organisations, providing analysis and updates to the Head of Division.
* Close collaboration with the Head of Division, the Heads of Unit and other senior colleagues in charge for the preparation of the annual list of events, budgets and event evaluation. Related tasks to be determined by the Head of Division.
* Efficient coordination with the Head of Division, the Heads of Unit and colleagues of the division as well as some other internal stakeholders will require regular presence in Luxembourg (monthly or at the request of the Head of Division).


**Qualifications**
* University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably oriented towards international relations, diplomacy, European studies, law, political sciences, languages, hospitality-travel-event management or corporate communication.
* At least 5 years of relevant professional experience in areas like protocol, diplomacy, international relations, official missions, interpreter, or VIP hospitality and business travel, of which at least 2 years in a confirmed protocol role.
* Excellent understanding of the EU institutions and relevant counterparties you will interact with.
* Sound experience with budget and procurement process and rules.
* Relevant and recent professional experience in a key EU Institution may constitute an advantage.
* Comprehensive knowledge of and experience with diplomatic and corporate protocol rules and activities.
* Experience with organising and accompanying official missions.
* Knowledge of high-quality hospitality and catering and event organisation.
* Ability to work both independently and in a team with an aptitude for close cooperation with numerous different inside and outside parties.
* Ability to oversee and coordinate the work of others, as needed.
* Proficiency in using MS Office standard IT tools and software applications.
* Excellent command of written and spoken English and French. Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage.


 Competencies
   

  

*Find out more about EIB core competencies* 
 here
   

  

 To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here
   

  

**Additional Information**
 The remuneration of staff hired directly at a post in an external office within the EU may be adapted to the costs of living of the respective country.
 *Please visit this* 
*page* 
*for more information on our benefits.*
 We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.
   

  

 We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.
   

  

 By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.

 ****18th January 2026****

title: Cloud Architect AWS - Migration Delivery
description:
Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.
   

  

**Din roll**
 Vill du vara med och forma framtidens molnlösningar?
   

  

 Du blir en del av Capgeminis Cloud & Infrastructure Services (CIS)-enhet med fokus på projekt- och konsulttjänster i Norden. Vårt mål är att erbjuda kunder helhetslösningar inom Cloud och vi erbjuder en mängd olika tjänster till våra kunder, från strategisk rådgivning till projektgenomförande.
   

  

*I denna roll kommer du ha en nyckelroll i att:*
* Leda vår kund genom mainframe moderniseringsinitiativ
* Driva komplexa migreringsprojekt
* Samarbeta med intressenter för att samla in krav och föreslå effektiva migrationsstrategier
* Agera som en betrodd rådgivare till kunder gällande branschtrender och ny teknik
* Dela kunskap inom organisationen genom mentorskap, utbildning och skapande av återanvändbara artefakter


**Din Profil**
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av molnarkitektur och implementering
* Praktisk teknisk erfarenhet av mainframe, non-x86 legacy system och av teknologier som COBOL, JCL, CICS, DB2 för z/OS, Assembler, PL/I, Java, Rexx, flat/sequential files, GDGs och VSAM
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av en teknisk roll med att migrera workloads från mainframe och non-x86 legacy systems till distribuerade x86 infrastrukturer antingen on-prem eller till cloud lösning.
* God erfarenhet av att integrera mainframe och non-x86 legacy system med distribuerade Linux- eller Windows-baserade x86-servrar
* Flytande i Svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift


 Önskvärda kvalifikationer:
   

  

* AWS-certifieringar på associate- eller professionell nivå (t.ex. Solutions Architect Associate eller Professional, DevOps Engineer Professional) är meriterande
* Erfarenhet av att leda kunder i initiativ för modernisering av mainframe och legacy system
* Erfarenhet av verktyg och metoder som används för att migrera mainframe workloads via hårdvaru-/mellanvaruemulering, automatiserad kodkonvertering, and re-platforming.
* Erfarenhet av att analysera och implementera lokala on-prem mainframes applikationer och datalager för modernisering av workloads


**Vad vi tror kommer få dig att trivas:**
* Konkurrenskraftig lön, förmånliga tjänstepensioner och kollektivavtal som ger trygghet
* Fokus på din hälsa och ditt välmående, med initiativ för att skapa balans mellan jobb och fritid
* En arbetsmiljö med kollegor som stöttar och inspirerar varandra, och chefer som har ditt bästa i fokus
* Brett utbud av karriärmöjligheter och tillgång till Capgeminis stora utbildningskatalog, särskilt inom den senaste teknologin för t.ex. cloud och generativ AI
* En företagskultur där mångfald och inkludering värdesätts högt


**Ansökan**
*I denna rekrytering hanterar vi ansökningar löpande. Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess kommer identitetskontroll att genomföras genom granskning av ditt ID-kort, och bakgrundskontroller kan utföras vid behov. Vid frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta ansvarig rekryterare Jessica Fogelsjöö, Jessica.fogelsjoo@capgemini.com.*
 Till denna roll söker vi medarbetare för säkerhetsklassat uppdrag placerad hos kund.
   

  

 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem.

title: Senior Security Infrastructure Engineer
description:
**Do you want to be at the forefront of protecting our society against cyber threats? We are looking for a Senior Security Infrastructure Engineer to team up with the most dedicated team of cyber specialists in our Secure Infrastructure domain.**
**About Truesec – A Leading Cybersecurity Company**
 Since 2005, Truesec has been a native cybersecurity company, driven by one single purpose: Creating safety and sustainability in a digital world by preventing cyber breach and minimizing impact.
   

  

 Over the years, we’ve earned the trust of organizations worldwide and gained a strong reputation internationally. Our team consists of dedicated specialists covering the entire spectrum of cybersecurity – with capabilities in Predict, Prevent, Protect, Respond, and Recover.
   

  

 Today, we employ around 350 employees – and as cybercrime grows, we need to grow. To support that goal, we are now looking for a Senior Security Infrastructure Engineer who wants to create advanced security solutions in our Secure Infrastructure Domain.
   

  

**Secure Infrastructure**
 Looking at the actual threat landscape today, it’s more important than ever to design and build infrastructure solutions that incorporate correct and relevant security features. The team works closely together using their combined knowledge and experience gathered from different projects and Incident Response cases to help our customers stay ahead of the threat actors. We continuously help customers improve their security posture within cloud, data center, endpoint management, identity, M365, and networking.
   

  

**The Role**
 The Security engineer interfaces regularly with team members and customers, determine technical requirements, feasibility of projects and expectations. You are responsible for maintaining, implementing, and designing client-facing solutions primarily in Active Directory, Entra ID, Azure and Microsoft 365 Security Solutions. This role is for someone who wants to be hands-on in a Microsoft infrastructure role leaning towards cloud but with the experience and knowledge of On-premises/hybrid environments. You must be able to think on your feet and you’ve got to want to learn and be part of a highly skilled and innovative team.
   

  

 Other responsibilities you might have can be:
   

  

* Run health and security checks on Active Directory, Microsoft 365 including Entra ID.
* Assisting our Customers with Tiering Projects.
* Provide customers with design and also assist with the actual implementation.
* Implement solutions based on Statement of Work with customers.


**Your Potential Background**
 We believe that your background probably entails 7+ years of experience and expertise within Microsoft solutions for both Cloud and On-premise/hybrid environments. You feel comfortable with guiding stakeholders towards a more secure and robust environment by giving technical recommendations that can persist the current threats present today.
   

  

 You are comfortable with guiding customers within areas such as: AD-Security, Entra ID-security, Windows Server Hardening, Azure security.
   

  

**Required Skills:**
* Active Directory Security
* Windows server Security
* Azure Security
* Microsoft 365 Security
* Overall a strong Cybersecurity competence within Microsoft Infrastructure.


**Bonus Skills:**
* Knowledge of scripting languages such as PowerShell and/or Python
* Cloud migration journeys from On-prem to Azure.
* Experience with Azure networking: Express Route, Virtual Network & Load Balancers
* Hypervisor knowledge of Hyper-V, VMware.
* Experience working with monitoring and logging tools (e.g.: Log Analytics, Azure Monitor, Azure Sentinel, ELK/ElasticSearch/Kibana)
* Experience with other cloud providers such as AWS and GCP.


*Due to the sensitivity in our assignments, we require Swedish citizenship, citizenship in an EU country, or a Swedish work permit.*
**Join Our Mission Toward a Safe Digital Future**
 If you truly want to make a difference and make our world a little bit safer, this is the place for you. At Truesec, you'll get to be at the forefront of fighting cybercrime instead of reading about it in the news. This is your chance to be part of an exciting journey in a leading cybersecurity company - and learn from some of the best in their field.
   

  

 So, are you ready to team up with the most dedicated team of experts and be part of a meaningful mission? Then we are excited to get to know you!

title: Lagringsspecialist till Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset
description:
Brinner du för teknik och vill vara med och säkerställa att vårdens IT-system alltid fungerar? Vi söker nu en IT-drifttekniker med fokus på lagring och backup till Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset. Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

**Du erbjuds**
* ett arbete med moderna teknologier och system som stödjer en samhällsviktig verksamhet
* att bli en del av ett kompetent och engagerat IT-team där vi hjälps åt, lär av varandra och arbetar tillsammans för att vården ska kunna utföras utan avbrott
* en nyckelroll i att säkerställa tillgänglighet, pålitlighet och säkerhet i vårdens kritiska IT-system
* möjlighet att delta i utvecklingsprojekt, såsom införande av nya lagringslösningar och automatisering av backupflöden.


 Självklart får du också ta del av våra generella förmåner som Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset erbjuder dig.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Som IT-drifttekniker med fokus på lagring och backup inom Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset har du en nyckelroll i att säkerställa att vårdens kritiska IT-system alltid är tillgängliga, pålitliga och säkra. Du arbetar med tekniska lösningar som direkt påverkar möjligheten att ge trygg och effektiv vård – där tillgång till rätt information vid rätt tidpunkt kan vara avgörande.
   

  

 I rollen ansvarar du för drift, övervakning och vidareutveckling av sjukhusets lagrings- och backupinfrastruktur. Du ser till att patientjournaler, medicinska bilder, forskningsdata och administrativa system hanteras på ett säkert och regelmässigt sätt, i enlighet med gällande krav på informationssäkerhet, sekretess och dataskydd (bland annat NIS2 och GDPR).
   

  

 Du blir en del av ett engagerat team som arbetar nära andra drifttekniker, systemförvaltare och IT-säkerhetsspecialister. Tillsammans säkerställer ni att sjukhusets IT-miljö har hög tillgänglighet, robusthet och återställningsförmåga – dygnet runt, året om.
   

  

 Arbetet präglas av ett högt säkerhetstänk, en noggrann struktur och ett kontinuerligt förbättringsarbete där du både hanterar daglig drift och deltar i utvecklingsprojekt, såsom införande av nya lagringslösningar och automatisering av backupflöden.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som**
* vill bidra till en trygg och modern IT-miljö för sjukvården, där stabil drift, tillgänglighet och datasäkerhet är avgörande för att patienterna ska få bästa möjliga vård
* har ett genuint intresse för teknik och ett särskilt engagemang för lagrings- och backupområdet. Du trivs i en miljö med höga krav på säkerhet, struktur och noggrannhet, och du förstår vikten av att IT-tjänsterna alltid fungerar oavsett tid på dygnet
* är lösningsorienterad, ansvarstagande och tycker om att arbeta både självständigt och i team. Du har förmågan att analysera komplexa tekniska problem och hitta hållbara lösningar, samtidigt som du gärna delar din kunskap med kollegor och bidrar till ständiga förbättringar i driften.


**Kvalifikationer**
**Krav**
* Erfarenhet av administration, drift och felsökning utav servermiljöer
* Grundläggande kunskap utav NAS- och SAN-miljöer
* Erfarenhet av backup- och återställningslösningar
* Förmåga att felsöka metodiskt
* Grundläggande Linux & Windows-kunskap
* Förståelse för nätverksteknik kopplad till lagring (t.ex. Fibre Channel, iSCSI, Ethernet)
* God dokumentationsförmåga och vana att arbeta enligt etablerade processer (t.ex. ITIL)


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av automatisering och skriptning (t.ex. Python, Bash, Ansible)
* Kunskap inom virtualisering och containerplattformar (VMware, OpenStack,Openshift, Kubernetes) kopplat till lagring
* Erfarenhet av prestandaoptimering och kapacitetsplanering för lagringssystem
* Kunskap inom dataskydd, kryptering och säkerhetsaspekter kopplade till lagring och backup
* Erfarenhet av arbete i enterprise-miljöer med hög tillgänglighet och redundans
* Erfarenhet av migreringsprojekt av lagringslösningar
* Erfarenhet eller certifieringar inom relevanta tekniker (t.ex. IBM ESS & Spectrum Protect, NetApp, Red Hat, Ceph, eller liknande)
* Erfarenhet av arbete i moln- eller hybridmiljöer med lagringstjänster (AWS S3, Azure Blob, GCP)
* Kunskap inom övervakning och larmhantering för lagring (t.ex. Nagios, Zabbix, Prometheus, Grafana)
* Erfarenhet av beräkningskluster och tillhörande prestanda/paralellfilsystem.


**Om rekryteringsprocessen**
 Urval och intervjuer kan komma att ske löpande under ansökningstiden.
   

  

 I samband med din ansökan behöver du bifoga CV. Istället för ett personligt brev ber vi dig besvara urvalsfrågor samt kort motivera varför du passar för rollen. Att besvara frågorna är en förutsättning för att din ansökan ska anses komplett.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan - Tillsammans är vi Karolinska!
   

  

 Inför tillsättning av befattning som innefattar vård av barn och ungdom, kontrolleras den som erbjuds tjänsten mot misstanke- och belastningsregistret. Här kan du läsa mer om rekryteringsprocessen och om vilka kontroller som utförs på Karolinska.
   

  

 Som anställd på Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset kan du komma att krigsplaceras. Läs mer om vad det innebär här.
   

  

 Om du är eller tidigare har varit anställd i Region Stockholm kommer vi att ta interna referenser från din nuvarande eller tidigare chef, om du blir aktuell för anställning.
   

  

 För tillsvidaretjänster kan provanställning komma att tillämpas.
   

  

**Om Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset**
 Vi på Karolinska Universitetssjukhuset är stolta över att vi är ett av världens främsta universitetssjukhus. Förutom vårt särskilda ansvar för den högspecialiserade vården i Stockholmsregionen är huvuduppdraget att tillsammans med Karolinska Institutet utbilda framtidens vårdanställda och bedriva världsledande forskning samtidigt som vi fortsätter vårt arbete med att utveckla vården för patientens bästa. Vi arbetar inom en rad olika områden och professioner.
   

  

 Vår vision - Vi ska bota och lindra imorgon det ingen kan bota och lindra idag.
   

  

 Läs gärna mer om oss på karolinska.se och följ oss på sociala medier!
   

  

**Att söka jobb i Region Stockholm**
 Vi eftersträvar jämställdhet och jämlikhet på vår arbetsplats och ser gärna sökande med olika bakgrund och förutsättningar.
   

  

 Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via detta system. Ansök genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök”. Ansökningar per brev eller e-post beaktas inte. Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser.
   

  

 Vårt rekryteringssystem kan inte hantera anonyma ansökningar eller sökande med skyddade personuppgifter. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig att kontakta den kontaktpersonen som finns angiven i annonsen. Din ansökan kommer då att hanteras utanför rekryteringssystemet. Du bör även vara försiktig med vilken information du lämnar i din ansökan och endast ta med information som är relevant för den aktuella befattningen.
   

  

 Region Stockholm ansvarar för hälso- och sjukvård, kollektivtrafik, regional utveckling och bidrar till kulturlivet. Varje dag, dygnet runt. I landets snabbaste växande region. Tillsammans skapar vi Europas attraktivaste storstadsregion.
   

  

 Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss i Region Stockholm (öppnas i nytt fönster)
   

  

 Fackliga representanter
   

  

 Namn
   

  

 Vision sektion Karolinska
   

  

 Telefon
   

  

 vision.karolinska@regionstockholm.se

title: Cloud Services Advisor
description:
Acronis is a world leader in cyber protection, delivering natively integrated solutions that monitor, control, and protect the data that businesses and lives depend on. Driven by our passion to protect every workload, we’ve built the industry’s only all-in-one cyber protection platform. We are looking for a to join Cloud Services Advisor on our mission of protecting the digital world.
   

  

 The Cloud Services Advisor, reporting to the regional Cloud Recruitment Team Manager, will drive revenue growth by identifying, qualifying, and closing new service provider partnerships in the middle east. You will manage the entire sales cycle, from prospecting and lead generation to negotiation and contract closure, while collaborating closely with internal teams and distribution partners. This role requires a hunter mentality, strong communication skills, and a deep understanding of the cloud computing landscape.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Attract new Service Providers to Acronis by reaching out to prospects that have already engaged with Acronis through offline/online events, registered for trial, opened Acronis emails, etc.
* Source new Service Providers prospects via LinkedIn, Salesforce database, connections.
* Connect with Acronis potential Service Providers using the approved tools, including but not limited to Avaya, Zoom, Outlook, etc. to verify the interest level based on certain criteria and BANT qualification, such as: the environment, need, budget, pain points, competitors, decision makers, number of workloads they want to protect.
* All activities must be documented in Salesforce, demo sessions via Zoom should be done with camera on.
* Do the research before reaching out to a prospect and prepare questions based on it, using company’s web site, LinkedIn profile, any other public information about the company or contact
* Manage the whole sales cycle: qualification, negotiation, demo sessions with the involvement of the Solution Engineers if needed, negotiating, closing the deal by signing a contract offline or online
* Make sure to sign a contract with quality Service Providers, who are ready to invest into the business with Acronis and plan to stay for a long time
* Manage the pipeline: maintain Service Level to follow-up prospects, provide timely forecast to direct Manager or regional General Manager
* Align and sync with Distributors in the assigned region, including bi-weekly calls, joint marketing activities and events
* Co-operate with all related departments at Acronis to close the deal successfully: Solution Engineers, Support, Sales Enablement, Product Management, etc.
* Understand Acronis brand messages and communicate them effectively to prospects; respect and support sales' role in promoting a positive brand image
* Understand Acronis key competitors and effectively communicate differentiators ("kill points") of our products/solutions
* Receive coaching feedback and participate in individual coaching sessions
* Pass obligatory quarterly upskill training sessions


**What You Bring**
* 3+ years sales experience as Inside Sales Representative or Lead Development Representative
* Fluent English, both written and verbal
* Proven experience in a Cyber Security company demonstrating a strong understanding of industry practices and protocols is required
* Ability to articulate product’s different features, and answers any questions customers might have
* Have strong closing sales skills
* Experience with cold calling is preferred with a never give up attitude


**Who We Are**
 A Swiss company founded in Singapore in 2003, Acronis offers over twenty years of innovation with 15 offices worldwide and more than 1800 employees in 50+ countries. Acronis Cyber Protect is available in 26 languages in 150 countries and is used by over 20,000 service providers to protect over 750,000 businesses.
   

  

 Our corporate culture is focused on making a positive impact on the lives of each employee and the communities we serve. Mutual trust, respect and belief that we can contribute to the world everyday are the cornerstones of our team. Each member of our “A-Team” plays an instrumental role in driving the success of our innovative and expanding business. We seek individuals who excel in dynamic, global environments and have a never give up attitude, contributing to our collective growth and impact.
   

  

**OUR INTERVIEW PRACTICES**
 To maintain a fair and genuine hiring process, we kindly ask that all candidates participate in interviews without the assistance of AI tools or external prompts. Our interview process is designed to assess your individual skills, experiences, and communication style. We value authenticity and want to ensure we’re getting to know you—not a digital assistant. To help maintain this integrity, we ask to remove virtual backgrounds and include in-person interviews in our hiring process.
   

  

 Use of AI-generated responses or third-party support during live interviews may be grounds for disqualification from the recruitment process and a full criminal, education and identification background check is required for all new hires.
   

  

*Acronis is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, marital status, national origin, physical or mental disability, medical condition, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.*

title: Group Business Controller
description:
We are on a mission to become the leading force in residential property management services. The global residential property management industry is currently undergoing a digital transformation and Odevo is at the forefront of this transformation. Our mission is to radically simplify living for families and individuals by delivering highly attractive and efficient property management services to building owners and associations as well as to residents. Our core belief is that digital technology combined with great people will play a central role in delivering a step change in how boards and residents experience property management.
   

  

 What we do matters to billions of people across the world. Residential real estate is the world’s largest asset class and buying a home is often the biggest investment a person or family will ever make. But the residential property management industry is lagging behind when it comes to customer focus and digitalization. That is why we formed Odevo.
   

  

 Leading property management companies in the Nordics, UK, and US have already joined forces to form Odevo and over the last 4 years Odevo’ s revenues have grown 40-fold to become a leading international player. Our ambition is to continue to grow rapidly organically and by attracting additional companies to join us in both existing and new markets.
   

  

 We deliver our property management services with custom developed software to simplify living and make life easier for property owners, association boards, residents and very importantly our own property management professionals. We make complex topics such as managing property finances and the daily maintenance of buildings easy, and we automate time-consuming everyday tasks so people can spend more time on things that they really enjoy.
   

  

 We are a 7500 employee company with a start-up mentality. We aspire to break new ground through innovation, and we actively cultivate a workplace where we can grow as individuals and have fun while achieving great things together.
   

  

 To continue our ambitious growth journey, we are now looking for people who share our vision to join us on a journey that will continue to transform the property management industry on a global scale.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are looking for a talented individual to join our Group Finance team, working closely with local finance and management teams across the organization. In this role, you will collaborate with Odevo’s operating companies to monitor financial and operational performance, contributing to both ongoing success and identifying opportunities for growth and enhancement. At the same time, you will be part of a growing Group Finance team in building the future Group function and reporting processes.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Lead the Group management reporting process in collaboration with the Group Finance team, continuously enhancing reporting models, presentations, processes, and structure while ensuring efficient reporting from local Finance teams.
* Design and implement a global reporting infrastructure for a hyper-growth company, supported by advisors/consultants. This includes transitioning from Excel to more automated reporting tools.
* Prepare and present business review materials for the Group Management team and contribute to sections of Board presentations.
* Analyse business performance across markets and operating companies to further improve business performance and to identify improvement areas
* Support M&A projects with financial modelling and assist in integrating acquired companies into the Group’s reporting structure, along with other post-acquisition activities within Finance.
* Drive ad-hoc finance projects, working closely with advisor teams when relevant.
* Collaborate with the Group CFO, CEO, and local CFOs/Finance teams to ensure alignment and support across finance operations.
* Develop and scale the Group business control team, playing a central role in building the Group’s finance capabilities.


**Who You Are**
* Entrepreneurial Spirit: A self-starter with a startup mentality, ready to tackle the challenges and seize the opportunities that come with a rapidly growing, international setting.
* Resilient and Bold: You thrive in dynamic, high-growth environments, persist through obstacles, and enjoy working within a dedicated team.
* Strong Interpersonal Skills: You demonstrate exceptional people skills, building relationships, and influencing others with humility and curiosity.
* Analytical Mindset: You possess strong data analytics skills, enabling you to leverage data-driven insights to optimize financial processes, enhance reporting accuracy, and support strategic decision-making across the organization.
* Curious Continuous Learner: Your enthusiasm for learning drives you to continuously improve yourself, develop those around you, and enhance business practices.
* Highly Organized and Goal-Oriented: You maintain a structured approach to your work, skillfully prioritize tasks, manage multiple assignments independently, and set and achieve ambitious goals.


**Experience**
* Excellent financial analysis skills
* Excellent Excel modelling, PowerPoint, and presentation (written and verbally) skills
* Financial advisory experience within M&A or Business/Financial control experience within corporate environment or equivalent experience


**Nice To Have**
* Experience working in Power BI and Aaro or similar software
* Experience from development of a scaling Finance function, such as financial planning and analysis systems or process development
* Experience within financial due diligence, management consulting or auditing is meriting


 We look forward to receiving your application!
   

  

 #msl

title: Testledare
description:
**Uppdragsbeskrivning:**
 Ett av Polisens största ärendehanteringssystem håller på att ersättas av egenutvecklade systemlösningar. I systemet handläggs ärenden huvudsakligen inom förvaltningsrättsliga området.
   

  

 I rollen som Testledare har du möjlighet att bidra till att skapa välfungerande och kvalitetssäkrade system för verksamheten. En stor del av de ärendetyperna som handläggs fokuserar på att tillhandahålla medborgarna service. Nuvarande systemstöd nyttjas dagligen av ca 1000 av Polisens anställda och samtliga anställda inom myndigheten har tillgång till nuvarande system.
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta i ett team med drivna uppdragsledare, utvecklare och tekniska specialister som arbetar agilt, nära verksamheten. Vi bygger en IT-lösning enligt verksamhetens behovsbild, baserad på microtjänstorienterad arkitektur och applikationer utvecklade i Java och React. En spännande resa som berör både medborgare och användare internt inom Polisen.
   

  

 I rollen som testledare ansvarar du för samordning, planering och genomförande av kvalitetssäkring och test i ett stort nyutvecklingsuppdrag på Polismyndigheten.
   

  

 Du ansvarar för att ständigt arbeta med att förbättra testmetodiken och teststrategin inom uppdraget tillsammans med teamet och vår beställare inom verksamheten.
   

  

 Kontoret är beläget i centrala Stockholm där vi erbjuder både flexibelt kontor och flexibla arbetstider. Det finns även möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån 2 dagar i veckan.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:**
* Säkerställa att testarbetet utförs enligt definierade riktlinjer och standarder
* Utarbeta teststrategier och testplaner samt följa upp dessa
* Ansvar för testmiljöer, versioner av tjänsterna och testdata
* Ledning och koordinering av testarbetet
* Genomföra riskanalyser och ta fram testfall
* Delta i genomförandet av testerna
* Rapportera progressen gällande testaktiviteter och resultat från genomförda tester.
* Hantera avvikelser och problem som uppstår under testprocessen
* Kontinuerligt förbättra testprocessen
* Samarbete med verksamhet runt kvalitet och acceptanstester


**Kvalificeringskrav (Skallkrav):**
* Relevant eftergymnasial utbildning inom IT, gärna med examen, alternativt att du har motsvarande förvärvad erfarenhet som Polismyndigheten kan bedöma som likvärdig.
* Minst 4 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av arbete i rollen som testledare
* Erfarenhet av arbete med automatiserade tester och tillhörande verktyg
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med förändringsprojekt i storskaliga och komplexa tekniska miljöer
* Minst 4 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av arbete med agila arbetsmetoder och ramverk som ex. CI/CD, DevOps, Scrum eller Kanban
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift


**Meriterande kompetens (Börkrav):**
* Konsulten bör ha erfarenhet av att ha arbetat inom säkerhetsklassad verksamhet.
* Konsulten bör vara certifierad inom ISTQB eller motsvarande.
* Konsulten bör ha erfarenhet av Confluence, JIRA, Zephyr, Cypress
* Konsulten bör ha erfarenhet av relationsdatabaser ex. MySQL, versionshantering av testdata
* Konsulten bör ha erfarenhet av arbete inom myndighet och särskilt rättsväsendet

title: Join the Leadership Team at Velora Health
description:
**Join the Leadership Team at Velora Health** 




  





**Strategy & Execution Lead (Marketing / Medical Operations / Tech)** 




 Location: Stockholm (Hybrid/flexible)
 



 Level: Senior – reporting directly to CEO
 



 Start: As soon as possible
 



  





**About Velora Health** 




  





 Velora Health is a
 **rapidly growing HealthTech startup** 
 on a mission to address the leading causes of preventable death. Our goal is bold yet simple: to
 **democratize access to a healthy and long life** 
 through the fusion of precision medicine, technology, and a holistic approach to health.
 



  





 We started our journey by tackling one of the biggest global health issues: obesity, which affects 39% of the world’s population. Through our digital health clinic at Velora.se, we provide individuals access to the latest and most effective research-based treatments.
 



  





 We’re ~20 people today — and we’re now hiring the next person to join our Leadership Team.
 



  





**The opportunity** 




  





 Reporting directly to the CEO,
 **you’ll be part of Velora’s Leadership Team** 
 and a key voice in strategy and high-level decisions. This is not a support role, we’re looking for a leader who challenges, sharpens, and helps drive the company forward.
 



  





 We’re looking for someone who combines sharp
 **strategic thinking** 
 with
 **hands-on execution.** 
 You’ll help set direction, then take full ownership of a critical part of the business and run it at a
 **gold-standard level** 
 .
 



  





 This role is designed around your strengths. You will take end-to-end ownership of
 **one** 
 of the following domains:
 



  




1. Marketing
2. Medical Operations
3. Tech / Platform Execution



  





**What you’ll own (choose one track)** 




  





 Track A:
 **Marketing Ownership** 




  





 Build a growth engine that scales access to life-changing care:
 


* Own acquisition and lifecycle strategy across channels (paid, organic, partnerships, CRM)
* Drive funnel performance (CAC, conversion, retention, LTV) with a strong experimentation cadence
* Lead positioning and messaging in longevity and obesity care
* Build reporting/insight loops the leadership team runs the business on
* Build the team and/or manage external partners as we scale



  





 Track B:
 **Medical Operations Ownership** 




  





 Scale a digital clinic that delivers outcomes, safety, and an outstanding patient experience:
 


* Own end-to-end clinic operations: workflows, capacity planning, quality, cost per patient
* Build SOPs and operational standards that scale across roles and volumes
* Drive quality systems, training, follow-ups, adherence, and continuous improvement
* Partner with medical leadership on care pathways and measurable outcomes
* Ensure compliance-ready operations and documentation



  





 Track C:
 **Tech / Platform Execution Ownership** 




  





 Turn our unique platform into a scalable product that powers excellent care:
 


* Own execution cadence: roadmap delivery, prioritization, quality, and reliability
* Translate clinical and business needs into shipped product improvements
* Strengthen planning, QA, releases, incident handling, and cross-team alignment
* Build scalable foundations for patient journeys, data, and clinic workflows
* Help hire and lead key roles/partners as the platform grows



  





**What you’ll do (in every track)** 




  




* Co-shape strategy, priorities, and operating rhythm with the CEO and leadership team
* Turn ambiguity into clear plans, owners, timelines, and measurable KPIs
* Lead cross-functional initiatives across clinical, commercial, and product/tech
* Raise standards, remove bottlenecks, and increase execution speed
* Be hands-on, this is a builder role, not a “slide-only” role



  





**What success looks like** 




  




* **First 90 days:** 
 Take full ownership of your domain, define KPIs and operating cadence, and deliver 2–3 clear improvements that move outcomes and speed.
* **Within 6 months:** 
 Your function operates at a gold-standard level with clear metrics, scalable processes, and a roadmap (and team/partners) to support growth.



  





**Who you are** 




  





 You’re a high-ownership leader who can zoom out and zoom in, from strategy to execution, without losing quality.
 



  





 You likely have experience from one or more of these environments:
 


* A fast-moving scale-up/startup where you’ve built or scaled a function
* A high-standard organization where you’ve learned what “excellent” looks like in your domain
* A strategy/analysis-heavy role (e.g., consulting, corporate strategy, analytics) and you’ve proven you can operate and deliver



  





 Most importantly, you bring
 **real craft** 
 in one core domain (Marketing, Medical Ops, or Tech):
 


* You know how your area is run at a
 **world-class level**
* You can set the bar, build the system, and develop the team as we grow
* You’re metrics-driven, structured, and decisive — and you execute with pace



  





**Bonus (not required):** 




  




* Experience in healthcare and HealthTech
* Experience scaling a function from early stage into growth
* Familiarity with Swedish healthcare context
* Swedish language skills are a plus



  





**Location & ways of working** 




  





 We’re Stockholm-based with a hybrid setup. We don’t expect you to be in the office 100%, the exact arrangement is flexible and will be discussed based on what works best for the right person and the needs of the role.
 



  





**Why Velora** 




  




* Real impact: help tackle one of the largest drivers of preventable death globally
* High ownership: run one of the most critical parts of the business
* The team: High standards, low ego, and plenty of fun along the way
* **Meaningful option package (equity)**



  





**Ready to build with us?** 




  





 Send your application (CV/LinkedIn) and a short note answering:
 


1. Which track you want to own (Marketing / Medical Ops / Tech) and why
2. One example where you combined strategy + execution to drive measurable results
3. What “gold-standard” means to you in your chosen track



  





 We’re looking forward to hearing from you.
 



  





 Best,
 



 Vidar Laestadius
 



 CEO and Founder of Velora Health

title: Non-Financial Risk Specialist
description:
**At Ayvens, progress starts with you.**
 Our ambitions to shape the future of sustainable mobility are powered by our talent. Join us, and get better with every move.
   

  

**Om Rollen**
 Som Non-Financial Risk (NFR) Specialist har du en central roll i Ayvens Swedens Risk- och Compliance team, eftersom en stabil och pålitlig hantering av operationella risker är ett av organisationens kärnområden. Som NFR Specialist kommer du att vara en del av första försvarslinjen (LOD1) och stödja organisationen i implementeringen av NFR-policyer och kontrollramverk för att säkerställa riskminimering i enlighet med Ayvens Groups standarder. NFR Specialisten fungerar som en enda kontaktpunkt inom de tilldelade NFR-domänerna och stödjer alla avdelningar i att definiera och anpassa Ayvens Groups krav på riskhantering och interna kontroller för den lokala organisationen. Du rapporterar till Risk- och Compliance Director och ingår i ett dedikerat team om fem personer som har nära kontakt med organisationen och även daglig kontakt med Ayvens Group/Société Générale.
   

  

**Dina Arbetsuppgifter Inkluderar Bland Annat**
* Implementera och underhålla ramverk för hantering av operationella risker såsom Outsourced Services, Business Continuity Management, New Products & Significant Changes, Risk and Controls Self-Assessment, Incident Management mm., med en kontinuerlig förbättringsstrategi för det övergripande ramverket
* Säkerställa att implementeringen av ramverken är i linje med lokala regulatoriska krav och Ayvens Groups standarder
* Leda och underlätta omfattande riskbedömningar för att hjälpa organisationen att identifiera och bedöma operationella risker
* Kommunicera riskfynd och rekommendationer effektivt till intressenter på alla nivåer
* Säkerställa riskmedvetenhet inom organisationen genom att utveckla och leverera utbildningsprogram till verksamheten


**Kompetenskrav**
 Vi söker dig med en kandidatexamen inom ekonomi, business management, finans eller liknande område samt tre till fyra års erfarenhet inom riskhantering. Du bör ha djup förståelse för riskbedömningsmetoder, riskminimeringsstrategier och kunskap om relevanta lokala lagar och regler. Erfarenhet från finans- eller leasingbranschen eller från en större konsultfirma är meriterande. Stark kommunikationsförmåga på svenska och engelska är ett krav.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Vi värderar högt din förmåga att navigera i komplexa situationer, ditt självständiga arbetssätt samt din förmåga att samarbeta effektivt både inom och utanför organisationen. Eftersom du kommer att ha en rådgivande och relationsskapande roll är stark kommunikativ förmåga avgörande, liksom förmågan att anpassa budskap efter mottagare. Är du framåt, positiv och en verkställare passar du perfekt in i denna roll.
   

  

**Övrigt**
 Tjänsten är på heltid (37,5 timmar i veckan) hos Ayvens Sweden AB med kontor i Solna. Hybridarbete är möjligt i samråd med närmaste chef. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande.
   

  

**Why Ayvens?**
 With over 3.4 million vehicles managed across more than 42 countries, we provide full-service leasing, flexible subscription services, fleet management services and multi-mobility solutions to customers of all sizes, including large corporates, SMEs, professionals, and private individuals. By leveraging our unique position to lead the way to net zero and further shape the digital transformation of the industry, we are well-positioned to meet the evolving mobility needs of our clients and provide them with the solutions they need to thrive.
   

  

 At Ayvens, we believe that our success is driven by our commitment to customer satisfaction. Our team is dedicated to delivering innovative solutions and technology-enabled services that help our customers focus on their everyday business. We’re committed to sustainable mobility and have made it a core part of our strategy. In everything we do, we’re guided by the principles of authenticity, curiosity, commitment and collaboration. We aim to foster an organisation that's diverse in people and ideas, where everyone can thrive and be themselves, no matter who they are.
   

  

 Join us on this exciting journey as we continue to enable the transformation towards large scale adoption of sustainable mobility and provide our customers with the solutions they need to succeed. Follow our page for the latest updates, news, and insights.
   

  

* ALD Automotive | LeasePlan are rebranding to Ayvens across all 42 countries by 2025.

title: Cloud Solutions Developer
description:
*Vill du vara med och utveckla affärskritiska lösningar som används av tusentals medarbetare varje dag? Hos oss får du arbeta i teknikens absoluta framkant, tillsammans med engagerade kollegor som brinner för innovation och kvalitet. Här får du möjlighet att påverka, växa och göra verklig skillnad – både för teamet och för hela verksamheten. Välkommen till en inkluderande miljö där dina idéer värdesätts och din kompetens får ta plats.*
**Om jobbet**
 Som Cloud Solutions Developer hos oss blir du en central del av ett tvärfunktionellt team som levererar kommunikationslösningar till våra länsbolag. Du kommer att arbeta nära produktägare, Scrum master och tekniska specialister i en miljö där samarbete och innovation står i fokus. Du kommer att tillhöra gruppen Utveckling Kundmöteslösningar inom Utveckling och Arkitektur på Customer Experience, där vi arbetar agilt enligt Länsförsäkrings-modellen. Vi samarbetar tätt med både interna och externa parter i en nätverksstruktur för att säkerställa de bästa lösningarna för våra kunder och medarbetare. Här får du möjlighet att arbeta med moderna teknologier och ta ansvar för framtidens tekniska plattformar inom kundkommunikation.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer vara bland annat:
   

  

* Uppdatering och vidareutveckling av våra InfraAsCode-lösningar i Bicep.
* Produktionsmonitorering samt förbättring av logg- och metrics-hantering i både applikationskod och plattformar som Azure, Splunk och Dynatrace.
* Hantering av certifikat och autentiseringsfunktioner i applikationskod och Entra ID.
* Förvaltning och vidareutveckling av befintliga funktioner samt implementering och lansering av nya lösningar inom kundkommunikationsområdet.
* Nära samarbete med länsbolagen och ökat ansvar för design och arkitektur på sikt.


 Följande kommer göra dig framgångsrik i denna tjänst:
   

  

* Flera års erfarenhet av utveckling och förvaltning av molntjänster, gärna med fokus på Azure och containerhantering.
* Gedigen bakgrund som utvecklare med erfarenhet av .Net.
* Praktisk erfarenhet av infrastruktur som kod (InfraAsCode).
* God kommunikationsförmåga på svenska, i både tal och skrift


 Meriterande är även om du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i agila organisationer, exempelvis enligt SAFe eller i Scrum-team.
* Tidigare arbete med kommunikationslösningar som Genesys Cloud.
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD och krav- eller testarbete.


 Som person är du kommunikativ och pedagogisk, med en stark vilja att samarbeta och bygga lösningar tillsammans med andra. Du har förmågan att förklara principer och tekniska lösningar på ett tydligt och inkluderande sätt för olika målgrupper. Du är coachande och vägleder med ödmjuk expertis, och driver designbeslut utan prestige. Ditt systemtänkande kombineras med detaljfokus, och du trivs med att skapa stabila, förvaltningsbara lösningar av hög kvalitet.
   

  

**Kontaktuppgifter:**
 Rekryterande chef: kjell.tillstrand@lansforsakringar.se
   

  

 Facklig representant Forena: jessica.loow@lansforsakringar.se
   

  

 Facklig representant Akademikerförbundet: lisa-maria.carensjo@lansforsakringar.se
   

  

*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
 Vi vill informera dig som söker tjänst hos oss att vi under jul- och nyårshelgerna har begränsad bemanning. Det kan därför dröja något längre än vanligt innan du får återkoppling från oss. Vi tackar för din förståelse och ser fram emot att återkomma till dig så snart som möjligt efter julledigheten.
   

  

 God jul och gott nytt år!
   

  

 Länsförsäkringar AB är en inkluderande arbetsplats där mod, möjligheter och engagemang står i centrum. Vi erbjuder ett hållbart arbetsliv med flexibla villkor och satsar på att alla medarbetare ska kunna växa och trivas, oavsett bakgrund.
   

  

 Digital & IT är hjärtat i Länsförsäkringsgruppens digitala utveckling. Vi driver den gemensamma digitala transformationen och levererar förstklassiga IT-lösningar, datadrivna insikter och innovativa digitala tjänster som skapar värde för hela verksamheten. Vårt uppdrag är att bygga en robust och framtidssäker IT-miljö – både på plats och i molnet – som möjliggör kundnära och effektiva affärer i hela gruppen.
   

  

 Hos oss möts teknik, affär och innovation. Vi arbetar tvärfunktionellt ute i verksamheten i agila team där utveckling, drift och strategi går hand i hand. Vi ansvarar för allt från IT-styrning, enterprisearkitektur och leverantörshantering till applikationsutveckling, cybersäkerhet och verksamhetsberedskap.

title: Sales Assistant TUMI
description:
**Job Description**
**Key Responsibilities:**
**Performance To Goals**
* Meet and exceed individual and store baseline goals for personal sales and KPI metrics inclusive of conversion, DPT, UPT and Client Data Capture.
* Take pride in work and strive for excellence.
* Take responsibility for performance
* Teamwork:
* Embody the company culture of coaching through fostering Tumi elite and skill practicing continuously with store team and provide constructive feedback to team members.
* Demonstrate organizational core values.
* Demonstrate an openness to new ideas and concepts while quickly learning and applying to the job.
* Complete quarterly goal setting for personal development.


**Communication And Relationship Building**
* Exercise strong verbal and written skills.
* Utilize active listening skills in order to seek understanding of others.
* Able to adjust communication to the intended audience.
* Demonstrate continuous dedication to ethical conduct in completion of job duties.
* Collaborate effectively with others.
* Openness to feedback from supervisors, peers and team.
* Ability to remain calm and deescalate situations.


**Compliance**
* Manage personal timecards to ensure payroll accuracy.
* Stay up to date with all training.
* Complete all assigned tasks and meet deadlines.
* Adhere to all company policies and procedures.


**Visual Merchandising/Client Experience**
* Ensure the store follows the visual guidelines and directives, inclusive of cleanliness standards.
* Enforce excellent client services through the emphasis of utilizing client books, thank you cards and executing event strategies.
* Ensure a consistent superior client experience.


**About The Team**
**Why you'll love working here:**
 At TUMI, you’ll find a dynamic working environment, joining a community where each team member is empowered with an entrepreneurial spirit. Associates are respected as a vital part of the organization and recognized for their contributions. We believe in a workplace that gives every individual the opportunity to make an impact, and our ongoing commitment is to provide all the tools you need to succeed— guidance towards individual career growth, professional training and development initiatives, and a motivating, exciting environment— along with competitive salaries and comprehensive benefits programs.
   

  

**What We Value**
* INNOVATIVE BY NATURE. SUSTAINABLE BY CHOICE. TUMI protects the things that matter most, the things you own and the planet you travel to see. Our planet is an astonishing place and we believe it’s our responsibility to preserve it for travelers of the future.
